reviews:
Flarra ölprovning med Peter. Denna relativt torr och smak av jordgubb och lite smultron. Välgjord 
Earlier Rating: 5/27/2015 Total Score: 2.9
Rostfärgad dryck som doftar klassiskt engelsk Ale. Det var längesedan jag Kände denna doft. Ja smakar lite rik fyllig Ale från England med inslag av lite amerikanska toner. Kola åh mjuk krämig i munnen. eftersmake lite sötma godis. Nja mesig öl säger jag.
Flarra hos P.N. Doft av rusin vanilj o lite the!! Smakar russin  o viss fatlagring. Toffee o mycket torrhet. God o lång smak! En härlig amerikansk barley wine!

bottle. medium brown pour with a beige head that has good retention. The aroma features brown sugar, toffee, and wet soil. The taste moderately bitter with c hops ( I guess), also in the flavor I get dark fruits, raisins and dates, and earthy-bitter hops. The palate is a bit lighter than I prefer, but still quite accommodating. Overall: Decent, paired well with some extra toasty cheez-it.

This is a nice barley wine beer but there are better examples. It's really bitter and tingy on the tongue. As with a great deal of US beers it's about overload on the ingredients and see what we get. Glad I found a bottle.
Feels a little aged and oxidized. Otherwise it’s like a light barleywine that you’d find nowadays, but defines the style in terms of the fig flavour. Beer temple ams

color: marron oscuro, espuma blanca persistencia media.
olor: alcohol, madera, caramelo,
sabor: amargor medio, muy licorosa, carbonatacion media, cuerpo intenso,

Colore prugna, schiuma bassa, beige, poco persistente.
Al naso frutta sotto spirito, in bocca biscotto e liquore.

Old notes from 09-07-14. 330ml bottle, ABV 9.4. Pours a light brown with a off white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of grapes, figs, dates, candy, caramel, touch of cinnamon & very present strong alcohol. Might be very well made, but lost on me as I think this is one of my least favourite styles of beer.

Coup de chapeau à la brasserie Anchor qui réalise ici un très beau Barley Wine avec un alcool somme tout modéré du haut de ses 8,8 % qui est à la fois riche aromatiquement mais également très bien équilibré permettant finesse et caractère. Le visuel est sur une robe couleur bronze sans mousse. Le nez est sur une bonne complexité avec raisin, figue, datte, candy, caramel et une touche de cannelle. Belle intensité sur l'attaque avec un alcool posant bien les arômes et un Barley Wine jouissant d'un excellent équilibre malt/houblon. Les arômes reprennent ceux d'un nez sur de belles variations. La deuxième bouche gagnant en intensité impressionne avec un alcool en retro donnant ce petit plus de caractère, alors que l'arrière bouche plus amère donne un bon contraste. Le final est quant à lui plus sobre mais sur une bonne longueur. Je ne m'attendais pas à une telle prestation, que je salue.
On tap from Barley Cargo, Athens. Dark brown - reddish colour. Heavy malty and fruity aroma, very bitter.

Reddish brown with a frothy head.
Grainy smell with a strong molasses note and some nutmeg. Predominant malty taste with a strong alcohol note.
Historical tick which I am adding as a rate so that I can see the impact it has on my stats. 500 Beers To Try Before You Die. Whole Food?
Sweet somewhat floral or piney maybe even citrusy brew which is a nice barleywine specimen. Carbonation notable. Good sipper for a hot day. Not tart or sour.
Dulce con una buena dosis de amargor Enel lateral de la lengua. Esperaba algo que fuera más dulce. No está mal

Bevuta in bottiglia da 33.
Aroma gradevolmente dolciastro, con note di vaniglia, perché ci sono! Prevalenza di malto.
Colore fra il rubino e il dorato scuro, forse bronzo con riflessi rubino. Buona schiuma. 
Amaro e dolce bilanciati. Nota di marsala.
fPr

Uklar mørk amber med offwhite til lyst beige skum. Aroma malt plomme. Smak malt plomme lim (ikke spør, det smakte bare rart). Mystisk øl som ikke falt veldig i smak, det var noe rart som jeg ikke finner ord. Delt med DjOeye

Aroma; plummy hops, syrupy strong malts. Look; fawn head on rose mahogany body. Taste; almond malts, plummy hops, spiced fudge, wood juice, and finish is strong. Feel; strong body n low co². Overall; it`s nice. [bottle tasted@ Hamna&Beer apr2020]

Barwa miedziano brązowa, silnie opalizująca. Piana beżowa, wysoka i trwała. Zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków, ładnie zdobi szkło.
W aromacie nuty słodowe, orzechowe, jest trochę suszonych, ciemnych owoców. W tle nuty ziemiste i tytoniowe.
Smak to jak wcześniej słodowość, nuty ciemnych i czerwonych owoców, ponownie trochę tytoniu i akcentów ziemistych. W smaku zachowany pozostał doskonały balans słodowej słodyczy, goryczki, o zabarwieniu ziemisto tytoniowym i delikatnej kwaskowej nuty owocowej. 
Alkohol idealnie schowany. Wysycenie niskie. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie i miękkie, Ciało wysokie o teksturze syropowej. Posmak długi, słodowo owocowy.
Masser af tyngde, aroma af harpiks, træ og en anelse caramel. Nærmest frisk i smagen. Full body, low carbonation, intet hoved og helt mørkebrunt dense væske. Greasy feel.

11-03-2020; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their March 2020 discovery box).
The looks of the beer are all right. The colour of the beer is a nice coppery reddish-brown. The beer is pretty clear, but it has a slight haziness. On top of the beer a nice layer of soft, almond colored foam is formed. The foam layer looks nice and creamy. Foam retention is average. Some nice lacing is left on the glass.
The aroma aroma of the beer is very nice. It is quite special and interesting. The malts give some nice strong aromas. There are nice loads of caramel and some toffee. Also a touch of toast. Besides this there are nice aromas of tobacco and plum, and dried fruits. Also the aroma of alcohol and some oak. It has the typical aromatic warmth of a Barley Wine. Besides these warming more heavy aromas, there are the hop aromas of citrus, orange marmelade, some pine. It is a nice contrast with the malts. Fruity and a bit piney, both light and robust. The result is a bouquet filled with a lot of different aromas, that are very harmonious together. Very nice.
The taste of the beer also is very nice. Sweet malts go together with bitter hops and sour fruity notes. The heavy sweetness of the malts and the fruity notes is balanced by nice strong hop bitters and fruit sours, making it well balanced. It sure doesn't taste too sweet. 
The palate of the beer also is nice. It has a full body and very smooth texture, with a creamy touch. The sugary sweetness gives it quite some body. The carbonation is low, but some of the sour fruit notes give it that tingle. The finish is very nice and long. It is filled with rich alcohol and malt sweetness, but mainly these lovely hop aromas. Filled with citrus and some pine; it makes for a very special beer. Different than most Barley Wines I've ever had. Good one.
Voroses barna szin, minimal hab, ami gyorsan el is illan. Az illata mennyei! Edes gyumolcsos. Izben is utos. Edes gyumolcsos, mazsolas, enyhen szilvas, konyakos beutes. Nem stilusom, de remek sor.

0,35l bottle. Pours cloudy brown with off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, resin and pine, dark fruits, brown sugar. Taste is strong, malty sweetness, bitter hops, caramel, resin, brown sugar. Hoppy finish. American barleywine for sure.

Media pinta @ Líquidos almacén de cervezas. Color ámbar oscuro, turbia. Espuma color crema abundante, buena retención. Corona fina. Aromas a lúpulos americanos, notas afrutados. Sabor intenso, caramelo, licorosa, amargor al final.

Cerveza de color marrón claro con algunos reflejos rojizos con una cabeza gruesa de color beige que se retuvo bien y dejo un bonito patrón de encaje.
Aroma a caramelo, malta tostada con un ligero toque a fruta seca y lúpulo.
Sabor moderadamente dulce, el caramelo y la malta afrutada te golpean de inmediato, el lúpulo presta una presencia muy apreciada, el acabado es seco y frutales.
En general, una cerveza muy gratificante, la recomiendo.

Red brown body with a creamy and dense beige froth. Scents of molasses, dried fruit and grass. The taste follows the aroma. Molasses, malt, grass and licorice. Typical sweetness of the barley wines, including in the aftertaste. Amazing beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish-brown color, foam shades, tan-white, nice but moderately durable. Wonderful aroma. Dried fruits, raisins, hoppy, but also malty. Sweet, cognac, yet round. It has an extraordinarily full-bodied taste, raisins, honey, malt, but with hops and roasted-malt, it has an outstanding sweet-fruity-cognac, bitter taste. For me, this is the perfect dessert beer. It resembles lighter double-bock. Lots of aftertaste, lots of dried fruit at every point of the tongue. Alcohol feels a little bit, but it does come at a disadvantage.
0,355 bottle.
Vörösesbarna szín, hab árnyalatos, barnásfehér, szép, de közepesen tartós. Csodás illat. Aszalt gyümölcsös, mazsolás, komlós is, de malátás is. Édes, konyakos, mégis kerek. Íze kiemelkedően testes, mazsolás, mézes, malátás, de a komlókkal és a pörkölt -sok - malátával kialakult egy kiemelkedő édes-gyümölcsös-konyakos, mégis "sörös", keserű íz. Számomra ilyen a tökéletes desszert sör. Világosabb dupla-bakokra hasonlít, csak felső erjesztésűként teltebb, összetettebb. Rengeteg utóíz, rengeteg aszalt gyümölcs a nyelv minden pontján. Az alkohol picit érződik, de nem válik hátrányára.Extrán ajánlom, persze csak a stílus kedvelőinek.

Amber color, the foam quickly leaves.
Nose. a kind of mixture of hop and malt Fruit notes. some wine.
Taste. The body is dense with soft carbonation. The taste is sweetish, a little fruit, a little port, a light bitterness. Great Barley Wine.

AROMA: Aroma muy maltoso: Notas muy altas de alcohol con un dulzor evidente y sin acidez. Notas maltosa a pan y lúpulo con tonos cítricos del variedades del Nuevo Mundo. APARIENCIA: Cerveza de color marrón transparente. Espuma cremosa de persistencia media-alta. Cantidad de espuma media y color crema. Deja "piernas". SABOR: Cerveza maltos acon notas de pan y caramelo que la dotan de una gran suavidad. Alcohol muy notable sin llegar a ser desagradable. Equilibrio maltoso pese al amargor del lúpulo. Sin acidez ni aspereza. Lúpulo herbáceo. SENSACIONES EN BOCA: Cremosa, suave con elevadas notas de alcohol. Poco o nada eferevescente. Final intenso que permanece en boca dejando un sabor agradable a alcohol. Cuerpo alto y sin astringencia. IMPRESIÓN GENERAL: Excelente cerveza, muy agradable y con una gran exactitud estilística.
# 548; 12/2016. Výrazný, plný pivo. Karamelové tóny, hrušky se skořicí, v dochuti čokoláda, karamel, černý rybíz. Povedené.

On tap at Craft Room, Opatovina, Zagreb. Cloudy amber to copper, small lasting off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramely, spicy, zest, cinnamon, lots of dried fruit, such as apricot or raisin, some alcohol. Very smooth, quite thick and sticky. Fine malt quality. Slightly resembling a brandy. Toasty notes. Ripe fruit, dried fruit, prunes, fruit liqueur - pear or prunes. Alcohol present, somewhat boozy, somewhat harsh alcoholic finish with a spicy touch. Strong and warming. Full body.

It pours deep amber with slight clouding. It has an off white head with low head retention. It has a strong malt and fruit character to start with in the aroma. There are notes of dried cherries and toffee. There are marmalade elements to it with alcohol that is noticeable. It is sweet initially with plenty of malt from toffee to some bread. The dried cherry flavors are also strong with some marmalade and low sherry like qualities. It is full bodied with a fairly high level of bitterness to it. The alcohol is noticeable but not hot. Overall, it has strong malt flavors with fruit and is sweet, but not getting into the cloying arena.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe. Clear amber body with a beige head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of honey, lemon and banana bread. Flavour of marmalade, menthol and mashed strawberry. A sweet, hop-heavy Barley Wine. You can tell with just a sip that this is a big beer, absolutely packed full of malt and hops.

0.335l bottle from Csakajósör. Red-brown opaque body, beige head, not very persistent. Aromas of dried fruits, caramell and nuts. Taste is dominantly sweet. Well, very sweet. But at the same time full of complexity, coming from various dried red fruits and nuts. Mild carbonation, alcohol warmth is strong. Mild bitterish aftertaste. Great beer, harmonic, complex.

Vierte en color ambar-melaza, con turbidez por frío que desaparece al atemperarse. Espuma de café muy persistente.
Con el carácter típico de una Barley Wine, destacan las notas de amontillado en nariz y de vermouth en boca, con buena intensidad y complejidad en ambos sentidos. Gran cuerpo y carácter cálido. Buena también como copa. Muy recomendable, aunque hay que saber lo que se va a beber.

Ciemnobursztynowa piana, ładna piana, delikatne zmętnienie. Przyjemny aromat, nuty tostowe, opiekane, trochę toffi. W smaku słodkie, ale nie za słodkie, toffi, karmel, kontrująca goryczka, delikatny alkohol.

Butelka 0,355.

Wygląd: herbaciane, lekko opalizujące, piana drobna, trwała. 

Aromat: lukrecja, przypieczona skórka chleba, miód wrzosowy. 

Smak: jest słodko, goryczka w szybkiej kontrze. Ciekawy posmak cukierków ziołowych, trochę Lukrecji. 

Unikalny barleywine, alkohol niby niski jak na styl. Piwo z charakterem, romansuje z belgijskimi triplami.

Bouteilles 35,5cl

Mousse : Fine voile blanc cassé

Couleur : Robe intense orangé sombre à ambré. 

Nez : Bouquet chaleureux houblonné et intensément fruité de cerise et épices de fin d’année

Bouche : Attaque superbe houblon amer, dès la 1ere bouche enrichi par un fruité tant intense que délicat cerise confite, fruits noirs, prune. Corps malté poursuivant sur le fruité et superbe houblon biter. Chaleur alcoolisée en fin de bouche bien dosée et parfumée aux fruits de fin d’année (Cerise, épices, …). Longueur houblonnée, sucrée, épicée….

Avis : Superbe strong ale puissante maltée, fruité et épicée, très gourmand, sans défauts, la cerise donnant un air de Barley/Brandy délicieux.

Bottle shared at Monyo. Pours copper with white head. It’s somewhere between a traditional, English style BW and a more modern, American iteration of the style: it’s as malty and herbaly hoppy as the first, but shows the bitterness and resinous hoppy character (mainly in the finish) of the latter. Medium bodied with low to normal carbonation.

Keg at the Euston Tap in 2013. Clear deep amber with an offwhite head. Aroma is malt bomb, with dark fruit, brown bread and slight Oxo notes. Flavour is malty again, but the sweetness is offset with light roasty bitterness and a hint of hop bite.
Bottle from Alko. Clear dark brown with tan head. Oak, booze, dark berries, barley. Smooth with plum, dark molasses, a hint of oak and sirup. Smooth and sticky with a long, sweet finish.

29.05.2015
AR: Sirup, Cream Sherry, Hopfen, Portwein, karamelisierter Zucker, kräuterig, medizinisch, überreife Früchte, Zitrus
AP: klares bernstein
TA: süss, fruchtig (rote Marmelade), Portwein, Hopfen, Zitrus, medizinisch, süss, Zitrus, überreife Früchte
Bursztyn, piania niska z obwolutą. Aromat miodu, toffi, palonego karmelu. W smaku słodyczka, toffi, miód, chlebowość, delikatna paloność z tyłu. Dosyć gładkie. Mocno ok.
Draft at beertemple. Aroma of sweet toffee, dates, malt, caramel and raisin. Taste has sweet caramelised malt, raisin, dates, caramel and bitter pine. Nice.

Bottles from Terre De Boissons, Centre Commercial Cite Europe, Calais, France; York Beer & Wine, 28 Sandringham St, York; De Bierkoning, Paleisstraat 125,1012 RK Amsterdam, Netherlands; Binns, Darlington.

2019 Vintage: Drank in 2019. Hazy copper coloured with a thin white head. It has a plum, dried fruit and spicy fruity flavour with a wine-whisky, vanilla and oak finish. Excellent!

Barwa bursztynowo-brązowa, lekko zamglone. Piana średnia, trwała, z lacingiem.
W aromacie dużo suszonych owoców, miód, karmel, brązowy cukier, zioła.
W smaku podobne nuty, intensywne, słodkie, z wysoką goryczką, trochę podobne do Komesa. Gładkie, z lekkim, przyjemnym alkoholem.
Świetne piwo.

I have been trying to describe this very distinctive flavor. Yes, this beer has a fruity, sweet aroma, but the flavor is separate and distinct from the aroma. What comes to mind is burning oak in the fireplace, or perhaps piles of leaves in late autumn. It’s that kind of beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a bronze color.  One finger tan head.  Clear, filtered.  No lacing.

Aroma is malt malt malt.  Candy sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, touch of oak.  Maybe touch of bourbon.  Caramel.  Touch of resin.  Burns the nose.

Taste is surprising, despite strong aroma.  Sweet.  Brown sugar, vanilla and alcohol.  Bourbon perhaps?

Mouthfeel is medium full bodied.  Not as heavy, rich, or thick as I would expect.  Could I go so far as to call it a session Barleywine?

Overall it is excellent.  Boozy yet approachable.  I would buy it again and recommend it.
Een heerlijke barleywine van Anchor. met 9,4% alcohol, een biertje waar je het warm van krijgt. Niet te zoet, niet te bitter maar precies goed.

Bottle with expiry 04-2019. Dark amber colour, minimal head, fair lacing. Aroma is lots of red fruit, also honey, toffee, citrus hops. Heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Not too sweet. Very pleasant mouthfeel, sticky texture, but does not feel cloying, pleasant sensation from bubbles. Well balanced. Very good! Probably the best barley wine I have tasted.

355ml bottle (BBF: 03/2020, 9,4%)  from Yeme (Tomasikova street) in Bratislava.
F: huge, tan, long lasting.
C: dark coppery to brown, clear.
A: malty, mellow fruity, caramel, dried fruits, bit vinous, some berries, herbal touch.
T: rich sweet malty base, mellow fruity, caramel, bit toffee, red berries, herbal, decent bitterness, bit citrus peels, spicy, bit warming alcohol, nice balanced, medium to full body, soft carbonation, enjoyed.

Botella 0,355l Color marron oscuro-rojizo.Espuma de color beige,fina,mediana,resistente.Aroma ciruela seca,fritos secos,caramelo,malta tostada,frutal.Sabor dulce con notas de ligero amargor,fuerte,malta tostada,ciruela seca,frutos secos,caramelo,especias.

Ich mag wirklich keinen Barleywine, aber dieses Barleywine Style Ale finde ich gut. Es ist eine wahre Aromenbombe nach einem ganzen Obstkorb ohne das leidige Kirschliköraroma. So trifft sich Pflaume, Ribisel, Apfel, Mango, Maracuja, Ananas und noch allerlei, ohne aber den Ale-Charakter zu verraten. So tritt die Hopfigkeit ein guter Partner zur Fruchtigkeit auf. Auch auf tiefgründige Malzaromen, sogar ein paar holzige Geschichten muss man nicht verzichten...und keines der Einzelkonstrukte spielt sich unangenehm auf sondern harmoniert mit dem Gesamtkonzept.

Color marrón rojizo con espuma media marrón claro que desciende rápidamente con buen residuo. Aroma a maltas tostadas, frutos secos, frutas oscuras fermentadas y notas a brandy, madera y vino. Sabor a brandy, cognac, madera y frutas fermentadas (ciruela, pasas, uva) con notas a galleta, especias, barrica y yogur. Gusto agrio con dulzor bajo y amargor medio, regusto añejo y de madera de larga duración. Textura semi-oleosa, cuerpo medio y carbonatación medio-alta. Una Barley Wine de sabores licorosos tipo brandy, madera de barrica y de poco dulzor con un toque agrio de fermentación que recuerda a algunas sour/wild o lambic.

Bottle at home, from Biervana, Munich, 20th January 19.  Pours a dark chestnut brown.  Aroma is caramel, burnt malts.  Taste is sweet, with some bitter character, caramel, burnt sugar and dark fruit.  Nice one.
0,355 l bottle.  This beer taste strangely, luckily in a good way :) Thanks a lot to the brewers.
Smell of oak, rum, syrup. Bronze colour, beige head. Aroma of oak, syrup, rum, spices, some roasted malt. Lively carbon, oily palate. Sweet, slightly bitter. Nicely balanced.
Butelka. Bardzo ładny balans żywicznej chmielowości i słodowości. Pije się to z przyjemnością, z każdym łykiem piwo się łądniej otwiera.

This vibottle has some age to it, BBE is 02/2017. A crystal clear deep red body with a light brown ring of foam along the edge of the glass. Nose has a strong sweet aroma of prunes, figs, caramel, molasses and gingerbread dough. Flavor is heavily sweet but a rather strong and firm bitterness balances it out nicely. The lingering aftertaste is definitely quite bitter. Low carbonation and rich but easy drinking mouthfeel. Very nice classic barleywine.

12 oz bottle reads 9.4% ABV. Pours clear chestnut with a two finger, beige head. Aroma is dried fruit, caramel and light roast. Taste is plum and caramel, moving to banana, roast and light hops. Finish is light hops. A good barley wine.

Clear reddish-brown color with nice white head which disappears quickly. Nice aroma of dark fruits, sweet malts, hint of alcohol. Taste has lots of dried fruits, berries, combined with malts and hops. Overall well balanced beer and easy to drink

Bottle, BB 04.2020. A good old-school BW, caramelly/toffee-y with a slight earthy dryness and kinda resinous bitterness; the body lightish, rather easy-drinking for 9.4% (as opposed to the 8.8% listed here), even though the alcohol starts to show after a while as it's warmed.

Ruby red clear beer with nice slightly beige head. Aroma has caramel malts, resin, piney hops, dried fruit and lots of malts. Taste is sweet with caramel malts, full malty tones and resin, piney hop punch in the end. Fullish body and low carbonation. Barley Wine is life.

How: bottle
Head: one finger, off white. Dissipates quickly.
Colour: deep red/ brown.
Aroma: caramel, red fruits, 
Taste: full body, "little carbonation", diffirent notes of caramel, fruit cake, bread, warm, long sweet aftertaste.
From backlog. 0,3 litre Bottle from Vinmonopolet Hamar. Brown with offwhite head. Malts, hops, toffee, and booze.

Bottle 355ml at home. BBE 4-2020. From Alko. Pours brown,  beige head.  Malts, dried fruits, resin, caramel, toffee, boozy. Full body,, slick oily texture, average carbonation. 

Original rating 9-3-7-3-14 from bottle 355ml at home 2011-05-11.
Donker bier met donkere smaken. Mist voor het type bier in mijn opinie veel diepgang en een groot gebrek aan ''bijzondere'' aroma's. -backlog de BierApp-
Full-bodied and sweet with berries and ripe fruits, nicely sticky on the palate.
An american, brown Barleywine with low head. Aroma is caramel, hops, light liqourice? light cloves? Taste is bitter. Vineous.

Robe d'un brun profond et col chamois bien crémeux.
Nez extraordinaire : beaucoup de fruits secs (raisins et dattes), malt torréfié et houblons. La liqueur finit par l'emporter.
Bouche puissante: caramel, café, cognac... Finale sur une amertume longue qui rend le tout très équilibré malgré l'alcool bien présent qui donne toute la chaleur et la longueur superbes de ce barley wine.
Un délice!
355ml bottle. Reddish brown with a minimal white head. Sweet caramel arom, that’s also surprisingly hoppy, flavour is toffee, apple, spice, sweet but not overly so

Color marrón rojizo, translucida, do dedos de espuma, burbuja uniforme, color amarillento, perfecta retención. Aroma y gusto en la misma linea, dilce, caramelo, pasas, miel, moscatel, madera, brandy, Porto,un punto de amargor al final del trago, muy sutil, y el alcohol te deja la boca calentita. Textura acuosa/oleosa. Barley Wine de manual, muy buena, no es la mejor pero si que sube la media, que dentro de este estilo hay muchas cervezas que son un sinsentido.

Aus der Flasche (bbe 06-2018) im 2018-08 getrunken. Da dieses Ale schon etwas länger in der Flasche war fand ich es jetzt richtig klasse. Vor Jahren hatte ich ein frisches mal probiert wo mir der Hopfeneinfluß zu stark war. Nun hier bei diesem hat sich die Hopfenbitterkeit den Aromen vom Malz, etwas süsses Karamell und eine ganz leichte dunkle Frucht.
Barley, caramel, hops in aroma. Dark red with quickly disappeared head. Sweet, barley, caramel, dried fruits. Full body, light carbonation.

Dark red beer, thin filmy head. Rich, wine-y fruit aroma. Taste is.... wonderful. Rich fruit, malt, caramel, bitter grassy hop. A warm, boozy finish to a hearty, tasty, rich, smooth fruity barley wine. This doesn't have the hit-in-the-mouth big flavour in the way of some of these but it's a delicious, velvety thing.

Bottle at home from the Beerhawk bar. Well chilled with a good pour and a very appealing deep, dark chestnut colour in the glass. The taste was that of a clinically well made barley wine. Huge sweet malts, a smooth mouthfeel and no sign whatsoever of the alcohol. There were no rough edges and I suppose that is my complaint; if you could call it that. It is so well made that it has very little character and could almost be described as soulless. I have had this thought drinking other beers from the brewery, but maybe I am being too harsh as this is still a benchmark beer.

Een robijnrood bier met een stevige kaki schuimkraag die netjes inzakt en na een korte tijd tot een dunne laag het hele glas bedekt.
Geur: Hop, citrus, mout, abrikoos.
Smaak: Vol en fruitig, bitterheid van de hop, zoet, olie achtig en warm alcoholisch.
Mond: Jammer dat je het toch een keer moet doorslikken, daarna even bijkomen en meteen weer een nieuwe hap uit dit heerlijke vocht nemen. Eindigt droog en aangenaam bitter.

09-2018 Aromat słodki, słodowy, miód karmel, babka piaskowa, przyprawy, chmiel. Nagazowanie duże. Ładna beżowa piana, klarowne o koloru herbaty. Smak bardzo dobrze wyczuwalna słodowość przełamana wyraźną chmielowością. Poza tym wyczuwalne chlebowe nuty. Gumowate pełne, ale gładkie, nie czuć alkoholu, finisz goryczkowy. Ogólnie przyjemne się to pije

Appearance Clear copper brown, almost no head 

Aroma Liquorice, dried fruits, booze, brown rum, fruity esters, caramel, dates 

Taste Very sweet, low bitterness 

Body Full, slick, low carbonation, warming alcohol sensation

Pours a deep red, good amount of very dense yellowish-tan foam. Aroma is too faint to really characterize, for some reason. Taste is malty and sweet, caramel, dates or plums or something, and citrus fruit, with an alcohol burn to it and a bitter hoppy finish.

Dark amber colour. Has a boozy brandy-esque nose. Taste of brown sugar, toffee, peppermint candy, red apples, raisins, apricots. Finish is sweet with some light hop notes. Pretty good, but not a patch on some other Barley Wines I've tried.
Deep ruby, clear, small beige head. Aroma: dry black fruit, burberry, candy. Medium body. Slightly yeasty and metallic on the end. Gret though

0,355l from Firmabier, current Beer Republic, BBF being in last September. Pours brown, light red color with medium head. Aroma of sweetness, sugar, caramel, malts, fruitiness, alcohol. Medium plus body, light bitterness, more on the sweet side. Quite dry, warm alcoholy finish. Sweet and a bit boozy barley wine, but is quite nice overall, I enjoy these kind of slow sipper ales quite much.
Прекрасный барлик. Плотный, сбалансированный, карамельный, фруктовый, пряный...дальше продолжать?) Думаю не стоит. Мои настоятельные рекомендации
Extraordinaire bière. Liquoreuse, amère, ronde, complexe, fruits secs et noix...magnifique

8.8%- I found this to be a bit too sweet. They are calling it "barleywine-style ale"....on the lighter side for a true barleywine. Light brown reddish appearance. Not that much carbonation which gives it a smooth, flatter mouthfeel. Flavor has some potential if balanced a little better, but either way was tasty.....just thought the sweetness could be toned down a bit. Maybe adding a bit more hops to the recipe would help? I have been liking Anchors beers, but will be looking elsewhere for my "barleywines".

W aromacie melasa, kandyzowane owoce, nuty utlenienia, słodko i przyjemnie. Z wyglądu rubinowe z beżową pianką. W smaku kandyzowane owoce, figi, grejpfruty, cukier trzcinowy, słodkie, syropowe z goryczkową kontrą. Degustacyjne, dość ciężkie, gęste, deserowe, ułożone. Bardzo smaczny, wzorcowy barley wine
Kleistą landrynę wynurzamy z dziegciu. Przymulające wielowymiarowo. Nigdy tego nie polubię.

Bottled. I have had this beer a few times already. Dark amber color. Head vanished quickly. Fantastic aroma of malt, caramel, dark fruits, ginger, plum marmalade, Christmas spices, red wine. Taste mirrors the aroma. Fantastic barley wine style beer.
Bottle from SB. Copperish amber color. Aroma is caramel, malt, a bit of dark fruitiness, grassy. Soft mouthfeel, fruity sweetness, mild bitterness. Balanced stuff, good mix.

Excelente calidad precio, espuma densa de gran retención, densidad media baja con bastante carbónico, olores a frutas pasas, uvas y caramelo, sabor semidulce a pasas y de escaso amargor, una barley wine muy equilibrada que gusta incluso a los no muy cerveceros, la tendré siempre en mi bodega.
Mörkt brun mot röd. Söt doft. Smak av choklad, dadlar, fikon o nötter. Måttlig beska bryter sötman på slutet. Mycket gott!

I've got to come down hard on this beer because it's not that easy to drink and it's so damn dry and hoppy. There are some initial great flavours of rich coffee chocolate cake and that kind of thing, but Chimay does this sort of thing much better and the alcohol is much better integrated. This was a bit of a burden to drink, and I like strong drinks like whisky, but this was something of the worst of all worlds for its genre.

bottiglia 355 ml, 8,2%, schiuma fine color beige/giallo media persistenza, color mogano limpido, al naso malto uvetta sotto spirito caramello spezie, in bocca è liquorosa intenso malto uvetta frutta candita zucchero di canna vino passito, corpo strutturato, leggero tostato, carbonatazione piatta, dolce con amaro deciso lungo nel finale. La mia prima Barley Wine. Molto buona 02.03.18
Fles 35,5cl thuis. 9,4%. Krachtig, zoetig, hoppig, scherpig, whiskytonen. (4-2013).

Brown reddish colour, creamy head. 
Aroma: spices, fruit, orange, caramel, some mint, some vanilla, dried figs, fresh. 
Taste: caramel malt, vanilla, cream, some tart fruits, brown sugar, plums.

Dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is port wine, malt, dried fruit, butterscotch, vanilla and walnut. Taste is medium sweet and moderate bitter with lots of thingt going on. Caramel, syrup, dried fruit, citrus, toffee and bread.

A really well-balanced barleywine, always a go-to. Doesn't have the murky appearance and excessive hop stickiness of many other American barleywines. Quite a treat when it has aged, though the floral hoppiness is nice when it is fresh.

Klar bernsteinfarben mit kleiner, weißer Schaumkrone. Angenehm malziger, fruchtiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig süß, fruchtig mit spürbarer Präsenz des Hopfens. Langer malzig-fruchtiger, nur leicht bitterer Nachgeschmack. Mittlerer Körper mit aktiver Kohlensäure. Ausgezeichnete Balance zwischen Ausgewogenheit und Aromentiefe mit gut eingebautem Alkohol.

Pours caramel brown with medium beige head. Aroma is raisin, caramel, toffee, some citrus, fruits, some alcohol, apples, cinnamon, pie. Taste is toffee, citrus, caramel, lemon pie, roast, bitterness, some alcohol, light hops, toasted bread, some pie. Superb beer!

1 finger beige head.
Dark maroon coloured beer.


Aroma is fresh red grapes, fig marmalade, vanilla and slight 'round' oak.


Taste is fig marmalade, raisins, brown sugar, light barrel notes and dried dates with some more 'uplifting', slightly citrusy hops at the back to counter out the heavy dried fruity notes.


Mouthfeel is very soft with a perfect, medium-low carbonation. Medium bitterness. Sticky and rich. Easy to drink.


Overall: No wonder this is a classic beer. Very good Barley Wine, feels very English for being American, but that's a plus in my book. Quite low in ABV for the style, but jam-packed with flavour. Very drinkable for the style aswell and not too heavy. Great stuff!
Djupt brunröd med stort krämigt ljust skum. Doft av söt malt, alkohol och vanilj. Smakar stort och sött med liten beska. Trevlig.

12 oz bottle served in a goblet.
Hazy copper colored body with a decent head and a bit of sediment. 
Partially hidden alcohol. 
Lightly sweet, Medium-light body and carbonation.

Pours a clear amber with thin head and average carbonation. Big malty aromas; caramel, molasses, dried fruits, raisins and strong alcohols. Taste is rich, fruity, chewy, a great sipping beer with just enough hop presence to prevent the malt sweetness and richness from becoming too much. Great barley wine.

Bottle@home, from Beer Republic. Strong, earthy nuances of toffee, bit sour dark fruits and barley. Balanced. Medium taste spectrum and long aftertaste with malty dark fruits. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall, organic even a bit funky but still slightly simple.

Pours a murky, oxidized rust color into a British dimpled mug with a prodigious lather. Aroma is ripe and and malty. Elements walnuts and burnt sugar. Finish is quite bitter, licorice and barley detected. Definitely benefited by cellaring, creating a smoother and longer palate overall. This is a burly, working class pub style ale. Solid proper...cheers Anchor Steam!

Amber - red colour, medium off white head with medium retention. Nice lace.
Aroma of raisins, red fruits, chocolate notes, dough,
Medium to full body, creamy nutty rexture. Medium carbonation..Dry finish, hops are noticed.
Taste of red fruits, chocolate, licorice, caramel, nuts, wine.
Good barley, though I'd like them stronger.

Aroma: Ripe tropical fruits, caramel, dried figs, rasins. Appearance: Dark copper, rather clear. Dense, abundant head, leaving nice lacing. Taste: Sweet: caramel, figs. Bitter finish. High bitterness, a bit lingering. Full body, medium carbonation. Alcohol hidden.

Suszone owoce, miód, cytrusy, karmel, alkohol. Treściwość średnia z lekkim plusem, trochę likierowej słodyczy. Średnia, krótka goryczka. Średnie do wysokiego wysycenie - niepotrzebne to, trochę drażni. Ogólnie smaczne i nieprzechmielone, jak mają w zwyczaju niektóre polskie interpretacje tego stylu.

A nice dark amber/dark red, still slightly transparent. Thin layer of white head that still leaves nice lacing. Quite strong and interesting aroma shows caramel malts, sugar, estery fruitiness and slight alcohol warmth with a resinous/grassy background. Taste follows the aroma closely with sweet malts (caramel, slight honey), some residual sugary sweetness, estery fruityness. Overall surely sweet but nicely balanced by alcohol warmth and by resinous/herbal bitterness in the finish. Medium to dense in body with average carbonation, overall quite soft in the mouth. Complex enough, nicely balanced and easily drinkable with a not too high abv for the style. Good stuff.

Thursday, November 30, 2017	11:18 PM	
12 ounce bottle poured to wine glass (no bottled on nor drink by: 7AG marking on bottle)	Sight: dark brown, minimal medium tan head, very hazy	
Smell: Malty, very fragrant	
Taste: low bitterness, low sweetness, very good	
Mouthfeel: lively carbonation, creamy, long follow through, sweet, then bitter aftertaste	
Overall: Very good beer

Clear orange brown pour with a thin layer for a head. Sweet roasted malts, toffee, caramel, butterscotch, honey, peppermint and mildly hoppy for aroma. Pretty sweet stuff, moderately bitter. Full mouthfeel and soft to medium fizzies. Mouth smackingly sweet, but my oh my, what a treat.

330 ml bottle best before 09/2017. Pours medium brown reddish, small head, not long lasting. Pear, wine grapes, liquor, brown sugar, some whiskey malts, dark cherries. Very balanced taste, malty sweetness with a dry bitter finish. Full bodied, soft to low carbonated, creamy texture. Alcoholic warmth. Very nice.

Barwa ciemno miedziana, piana niewielka.
Aromat śliwek, rodzynek, fig, troszkę miodu, karmel.
W smaku suszone czerwone owoce, karmel, śliwka. Delikatnie słodkie, delikatne kwaśne, z delikatną goryczką. W smaku fantastyczne. Trochę brakuje ciała a alko całkowicie ukryte.
Super pifko.

Farbe: rotbraun mit cremigem beigem Schaum. Geruch: malzig, alkoholisch, würzig. Geschmack malzig, leichte Süße, etwas alkoholisch. Aromen von Kirschen, etwas Marzipan und holzig. Dazu eine schöne dezente Bitternote. Tolles Bier!

Superbe robe rubis/ambrée profond qui rappelle un peu celle d'une Samichlaus. Belle mousse également avec une belle teinte ivoire. Le nez est déroutant car on a dans le même temps une bière aux accents de Barley Wine, de Tripel et d'Imperial IPA. Le côté gourmand est très présent, avec des notes de sirop d'érable et de miel très claires, des notes de noisette, de caramel, de chocolat à la fleur de sel, de banane, d'ananas, de mangue, de pêche, de fruits rouges, de baies, de figue, de réglisse, de myrtille... De belles notes florales viennent compléter le tout. Très beaux arômes donc pour ce Barley Wine avec un côté houblonné assumé. En bouche, texture suave, liquoreuse, presque huileuse, beaucoup de corps, de beaux sucres résiduels, un alcool très expressif et surpuissant, une petite amertume bienvenue sur ce type de produit. En rétro-olfaction, flaveurs de bonbon arlequin et de chocolat au lait ainsi que de noix fraiche en arrière-goût. La carbonatation est relativement correcte pour un Barley Wine. Sur les gorgées suivantes viennent se greffer d'autres flaveurs inattendues, comme le bois légèrement brûlé, le café très torréfié, la mélasse, la chicorée. L'alcool est vraiment à la hauteur (8.2% sur mon exemplaire, 7 mois avant sa date) et pousse de toutes ses forces. L'amertume et les sucres se prêtent à une belle compétition au palet sur la longueur, pour finir par une sorte de match nul. En attendant, ils participent pleinement au final tandis que les goûts maltés jouent les arbitres. Une fois de plus, ce petit côté bonbon qui revient par petites touches. En conclusion, un Barley Wine très typé, très original et complexe mais néanmoins extrêmement bon. Superbe pioche que cette Old Foghorn qui mérite la meilleure des notes, et ce sera ma première Américaine à y parvenir ! Bouteille 35.5cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Strong malty aroma with hints of cherry liqueur, dried dates, figs, ripe banana. Full body and very low carbonation. Taste: lots and lots of malt, caramel, cherries, dates, some wine and bitterness. Again malt, sweetness and bitter in the long after. Amazing ale overall but a bit to sweet for my taste.

Piwo kultowe, ikona. Jeden z najbardziej znanych wyznaczników stylu. Dla mnie to również pierwszy kontakt z piwem Anchor Brewing. Piwo ma barwę ciemnobursztynową, jest klarowne, po przelaniu do szkła wygląda jak mocno zaparzona herbata. Odróżnia je od niej jedynie piana, która dla mnie jest w wyglądzie Old Foghorn jedynym minusem. Piwo przy nalewaniu mocno się pieni, robi sporo szumu, piana jest pomarańczowa, dość obfita, zbudowana ze średnich i nawet dość dużych oczek, szybko opada, po kilku chwilach zostaje po niej tylko pierścień przy brzegach, śladów na ściankach brak. W aromacie jest mocno słodowo, przez to wręcz słodko. Czuć nieco alkohol, ale nie jest nieprzyjemny, lekko piecze w nozdrza, przybiera jakby likierowy charakter, słodycz obecna w aromacie jeszcze podbija to skojarzenie. Jest też trochę cytrusów, choć nie grają tu istotnej roli, raczej stanowią tło. W smaku... jak dla mnie nie jest dobrze. Nie jest też bardzo źle, ale sporo lepszych Barley Wine z Polski miałem okazję pić. Przede wszystkim wyraźny alkohol i tu już w nieco nieprzyjemnym spirytusowym tonie. Jest lekka kwaskowatość, tak w typie cytrusowym. Brakuje goryczki. W pierwszym akordzie jest słodko, w drugim dołącza wspomniana kwaskowatość, a na końcu to alkoholowe pieczenie w przełyk. Fajnie dzieje się w posmaku, są tu nuty suszonych owoców, może nie śliwki, ale brzoskwinie, daktyle, figi już jak najbardziej. Wysycenie niskie, widocznie piwo rozgazowało się podczas nalewania, kiedy to powstało dużo piany. Jak to często bywa w przypadku piw z "wagi ciężkiej", w miarę picia wydaje się coraz smaczniejsze i coraz więcej jego zalet dostrzegam. Jedną z nich jest goryczka, której na początku mi brakowało, a później, kiedy już alkohol trochę uderzył do głowy, pojawiła się może niewysoka, ale jednak wyraźnie się zaznaczająca goryczka w ziołowym typie. Cieszę się, że spróbowałem tego klasyka, ale nie zrobił na mnie wrażenia.
(my first barley, claque, robe cognac, nez pineau frais, fin de bouche calva-mère, moût, bois, miel, amande, lasts)

From Mar 2006

Poured from bottle(room temp) a dark gold with very little head of foam at first but it grows into about a 1 inch layer that dissipates slowly but stays for the entire session.

The smell is very fruity with some malt notes also hitting my nose.

The taste is *very* malty sweet at first sip with some strong fruitiness(major plum notes) that I mentioned in the smell. Subsequent sips give me more of the malt but it's not as sweet and the hops start to do their bit making for a better balance than you'd think after the initial taste. Oh, and it's quite warming for the 8.8%abv this BWSA carries so 1 of these and I'll be done for quite a while.

Bottom line: A good, malty interpretation of an American BWSA that I will pick up from time to time because it *does* seem to break away from the mainstream. I recommend it.

Small ass bottle..( old notes from August 2017 @ the "pro brexit , please get a visa BBq) my friend Seamus from northern Ireland with dup sympathise suggested to some eu citizens @ said summer bbq that brexit was about social liberty and an argument occurred. I agreed with Seamus..I sat back with a bottle of this and let them bicker. Headless and murky piano brown brew. Nose of dark fruit, booze and caramel. Tastes the same, like chunky booze melting my brains. I think this was too young and hote.
Sticky sweetish beginning. Grain, smooth mild sugars, deep and thick with lots of sugary grain.

0,355 l bottle Cellar aged at home: BB 2015 
brown, red, hazy, frothy, brown foam, butterscotch, woody, floral, dried fruits, caramel, alcohol, leaves, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Copenhagen 28/9 2017. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny. Little Chubby bottle. Very botanic label with Corn Ears and some hops laying around. Pours clear amber with a red hue and off-white bubbly head. Settles as thin patchy and flimsy layer of foam. Aroma is intense and bitter-sweet with the sweetness in the front seat. Sugary caramel intermingling with strong, sourish notes. Figs and hints of sherry. Soft carbonation and medium thick palate. A little sticky. Flavor is heavy sweet and vinous. Light sour bitterness and a little spiciness. Aftertaste is sweet and boozy. Sweet, heavy, vinous brew with spicy after taste.
Bottle at home. Clear deep amber color, white head. Malts, tofee, caramel, good beer
Rather good Barley Wine. Pours a nice glass of thick brown beer. It's sweet has an interesting hoppy aroma and is overall highly enjoyable.
Keg at the brewery. Reddish brown. Nose is sweet malty, red berries, caramel. Tastes malty, sweet caramel, red fruits, some hops.

12oz bottle. Pours mahogany with a small light tan head. Aroma is plum, toffee, honey, caramel, and toast. Taste is toffee, plum, light roast, some vanilla, fig, caramel and brown sugar. Medium-full body. Medium - but not assertive - carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. [700th rating]

Bottle 0.355l. Cloudy, deep amber colored. AROMA- honey and caramel, very pleasant alcohol, tones of cinnamon and clove. FLAVOR- just slightly sweet, alcohol, pleasant caramel. Full bodied. 
Tasty.

#1621
Bottle. Hazy red to amber body, smal yellowish head. Aroma of star anise, cinnamon, alcohol, clive, malt. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Caramel, alcohol, touch of spiceness. Fuller body, medium carbonation. 
OK, but a bit disappointment.

Color marrón tirando a rojo. Poca espuma, blanca y duradera. Aroma dulce, a malta yo diría que caramelizada, y sabor a frutas, de donde creo reconocer las pasas. El sabor lo he notado igual, muy dulce. Final un poco amargo, pero casi nada. El alcohol es inapreciable. Muy recomendable.
W aromacie na początku ananas, pomarańcza, potem rodzynki, miodek. W smaku jest dosyć landrynkowo, drugie skrzypce gra tu taka chlebowość. Brakuje trochę ciała, ale piwo naprawdę fajne.

From Decervecitas. In Teku glass. Playing Thats Mahjong, then Cannon Defenders. Toffee and figs. Good aroma but in mouth the alcohol is too much noticeable for such an ABV. Bbf this month (my fault). To repeat fresher
brown body and white foam. Vanilla and citric flavours. Citric and malty taste.  High carbonation and low alcool.
Good barley-wine. Not as intense as we all think it has to be. Aroma is typical barley wine-ish, a little bit just its watery(i guess,asi remember)

Very good beer. Subtle tastes. Slightly sweet, but not overly so. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle at home. Clearish amber brown with a thin off-white head. Caramel, bread, sweet malt, plums, oranges, resiny hops. Full bodied. Sweet malt, fruit and spice in the warming finish. Maybe a little lighter and fresher than some other BWs. This is just awesome - delicious.

Bottle from Damian. Pours dark amber with little head, aroma of plums, sweet. Rich barley taste, plums, dark fruits, rather heavy, very pleasant, medium sweet, long barley wine, sweet finish. Very nice

Botella 33 cl en el Lúpulo Oviedo diciembre 2010. Fcpref 04..2011. (r2238). Tomada en varias ocasiones. Color oscuro con espuma beige. Sabores intensos acaramelados ligeramente tostados y quemados. Maltosos dulces. Cuerpo medio a intenso con buena sensación alcohólica desde el principio. 9.4 vol. Muy valorada en su momento. Bastante buena para repetir sin duda.
Kersenhout rood van kleur. Stevig schuim. Mooi caramel van smaak. Licht gehopt. Aangenaam zoet

335 ml bottle at Getränkefeinkost Lüneburg. This bottle has 9.4% vol. Pours with a clear ruby-brown color and a small white head. Nice nose of rasiins, sweet malts, dried fruits, molasse, vanilla and old barrel wood. Taste is much more dry than exxpected. The fine aroma of the nose gets a liitle bit lost. Taste is fruity, with some burnt sugar, some herbal flavors and a slightly bitter (tannin) dry finish.
17/20 loved it, different taste, malty sweetness, really well balanced, very boozy but also makes you want to drink more

Przyjemny aromat. Owoce, lekka cierpkość, kandyzowany cukier. 
Jest trochę nut chmielu. 
Całość pachnie dość ostro, estrowo. Jest lekki alkohol. 
Później się układa. Jest nuta owocowa, lekko słodka. 
Pachnie jak dobre barley wine. 
W odczuciu lekko likierowe, geste. Nie jest mocno wysycone. 
Trochę kwaskowe w smaku. 
Jak dla mnie mogło być bardziej gęste, więcej ciała.
Bottle from AJ’s Beer Warehouse. Aroma of dark fruit esters, caramel malts.

12oz bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam and poured into a snifter on 4-Aug-2017. Clear reddish amber with a thick beige coloured head. Aroma of sweet malt, fruit and hops. Full body and medium carbonation. Taste is sweet fruit, dominated by burnt banana and caramel. Medium spiced with a sweet, light bitterness to the finish. A heavy dessert beer.
Lasissa sameisen ruskea. Tuoksuu voimakkaasti, mukana mm. toffeeta, taatelia ja luumua. Maku on makea, mutta ei liiaksi. Amerikkalaistyyliin mukana on myös humalaa, mikä tuo tasapainoa.
Bottle. Thick and tasty. Both sweet and bitter. Not my favorite kind of beer, but this is very drinkable.

Pours dark copper with a lively beige head. Aroma is caramel, fruits.. Nothing special. Flavor is sweet as candy. Caramel, apples... Nice bittersweet touch near the end. Bit of a mild barley wine if you ask me. Guess some ageinig would do well to this brew.
Best barley wine I’ve ever tried. Very well balanced. Dried fruits and roast notes, not too sweet or alcoholic. Awesome!

Keine Perlen, wenig Schaum, aber schönes klares Rotbraun im Glas. In der Nase Beeren, Holzfass. Im Trunk süß, Cognac, Beeren, Kirschen, Holzfass. Keine Spur zu alkoholisch. Praline. Herrliches Aromaspiel auf der Zunge. Langer Abgang. Teuflisch gut trinkbar. Granatenstark!
Thick, rich and creamy. Notes are breadcrumb, dried apricot, molasses, caramel, tar. Malt goodness, amazingly well balanced. Definitely world-class.

Flasche 0,355l (ABV: 8.2%): Mahagoni, klar, mäßig stabiler mittelporiger beiger Schaum; würzige + sehr süße Nase, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, Rumrosinen, Datteln, leichte fruchtige Säure, Malz, Malzzucker, dunkles Karamell, leichte Röstaromen, dunkle Schokolade, Trockenfrüchte; fruchtiger + kräftig würziger Körper, kräftige Süße, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Trockenfrüchte, Hopfennoten, Röstmalz, Malzzucker, dunkles Karamell, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, Röstaromen; angenehmer fruchtig-würziger Nachgang mit Hopfennoten

355ml bottle from Naples supermarket pours deep amber with tiny tan head. Aromas of toffee, hops, grass and sugar cane. Flavours of caramel malt, molasas, raisins, sugar syrup and herbal characters. Great texture and depth hide the alcohol well. A really balanced barley wine with plenty of character.

bottle, 8.2%, red-ish dark amber, clear, small, off white head.
fruity, malty, honey, raisin.
nice bitterness to balance the sweetness, medium body, a bit to thin for the sweetness.

355 ml bottle, 8.2% ABV. Pours a clear dark amber with an off-white head. The aroma is malty, honey, caramel, toffee, dark fruits an an underlying hoppiness (herbal, pine) with some noticeable alcohol. Full body with a very low carbonation, a medium sweetness and a light bitterness. The flavor pretty much follows the aroma is dominated by the sweet maltiness - caramel, honey, molasses, brown sugar, spices - while the citric and herbal hops are nicely balancing the brew.

Bottle: 355 ml, Price: 0,89 eur 

Nesužavėjo . . . . . .

Butelka, 03.2018. W aromacie miód, karmel, czerwona porzeczka. W smaku jest karmel i miód, ale są złamane dosyć sporą kwaskowatością, też jakby czerwona porzeczka, na końcu, dopiero po chwili pojawia się lekka goryczka, bardzo krótka. Kolor czerwono miedziany, bardzo klarowne, piana średnia kremowa, niezbyt trwała, ale jak na barley wine i tak dosyć obfita. Wysycenie trochę za wysokie, przez co piwo sprawia wrażenie lekkiego i niezbyt gęstego, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty w smaku, po ogrzaniu lekko wychodzi w aromacie.

Pours red/brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is caramel, apple schnapps, peppermint. Taste is malty sweet, lots of caramel, with a fruity twang. Turns warm and bittersweet at the finish. Overall a complex mix of flavors. Full-bodied, rich, creamy palate with a mild carbonation. Very good, although I can’t quite make up my mind how high to place it. 
Re-rate: overall similar impressions. Noticeable apple in the fruity tang. 4.0

Kept this bottle in my basement for a pretty good while; picked it up sometime in Feb 2015! After more than two years in the chilly, dark cellar this is just about one of the best libations to ever play upon my tongue. A little smoky and a little oaky, with amazing malt/hop combo, it doesnt get much better than this. Stellar effort, keep em coming, Anchor!

Bottle; pours dark amber with an off white head; aroma of caramel, dried fruit, honey, and a hint of spice; taste is sweet with caramel, honey, dried fruits, and a hint of vanilla; finish is dry and sweet; very good

My 2000th rating. 12 ounce bottle. Tawny reddish copper color topped by a small creamy beige head. Rich toasted malt nose hints a dark dried fruit, vanilla and herbal hops. First sip offers sweet malt flavor with notes of raisins, caramel, figs, vanilla and brown sugar. rich and complex. As it warms, it becomes soft and bittersweet with a touch of maple syrup. Warming alcohol notes in finish. for todays standards, this may seem tame as Barley wines go. However, it is a very good example of the style.

Miedziane, klarowne piwo o średnie pianie, która redukuje się do zera. Aromat bardzo przyjemny, słodki, miód, rodzynki, toffi, delikatny alkohol. W smaku słodkie, gęste, oleiste, miodowe, owocowe,toffi, ziołowe. Goryczka wysoka ziołowa. Ogólnie uwielbiam takie piwa, słodkie, gęste, ułożone skontrowane fajną, mocną goryczką, jedno z moich ulubionych piw, bardzo przypomina mi Quatro od Pinty.
Clear amber, small offwhite head. Aroma has caramel, notes of dried fruit. Sweet malty flavour, caramel and alc warmth.

Bottle. Clear red colour, firm tan head, good lacing. Aroma of dried and crystallized fruits, raisins, caramel, light notes of honey. Taste is heavy- sweet and medium- bitter, caramely and bready base, lots of candy fruits, raisins, dried fruits, slightly herbal finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is average. Great, sweet, fruity and complex example of the style.

Pite z butelki. Piękna barwa, jasne, rubinowe. W zapachu mocne nuty chleba, słodów, rodzynek i miodu. W smaku to samo. Słodkie, gęste, treściwe i bardzo smaczne. NIestety nie nazwę tego Barley Wine, gdyż moja butelka zdecydowanie różni się od innych przedstawicieli tego stylu. Powiedziałbym, że bł to Imperial Bock, co mi bardzo zasmakowało. Super piwo.
Ocena na podstawie numerycznych zapisków z degustacji piwa w multitapie. Wersja z butelki 0,355L

Butelka. Piana niska, kremowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, szybko opada do obwódki, koronkowanie słabe. Barwa miedziana, klarowne. Aromat intensywny, słodki, słodowy, rodzynki, winogrona, suszone figi. Goryczka średnia, alkoholowa. W smaku słodowe, estrowe, lekka kwaśność, lekko alkoholowe. Pełnia średnia plus, nasycenie średnie.
Phenomenal all-around beer, doesn’t fall in the nauseatingly sweet trap of many barley wines, a slight smoky plot in the overall fruity taste narrative provides the requisite complexity

Butelka 330ml (BB 03.2018). Klarowne o miedzianej barwie z cieniutkim kożuszkiem piany w kolorze ecru, całkiem trwałym choć tylko symbolicznie zdobi piwo. Aromat słodki, ciężki, słodowy, karmelowy w odczuciu podobny do aromatu miodu pitnego. W smaku słodkie z wyraźną, średnią do wysokiej, ziołową goryczką na finiszu, który stanowi bardzo dobrą kontrę dla słodyczy. Piwo jest oleiste, wyraźna słodycz delikatnie oblepia wargi a samo piwo dość mocno rozgrzewa od przełyku do samego żołądka choć alkohol jest dobrze ukryty. Niskie nasycenie i słodycz nadają piwu pełnię przez co pije się je powoli, delektując każdy łyk. Bardzo dobry, słodko-goryczkowy barley wine.
Beautiful, complex EBW cellar aged for 3 years. Deep copper color with a light hop nose still present. Malt base is sweet and complex with a refined hop finish.

I’m appreciative that a commonly available brewery has seen fit to consistently produce an English style Barleywine. And it happens to be a very good one that is attractively priced. Malty, fruity, rich with a subtle hop background.  Wonderful, oily mouthfeel.  Old Foghorn seems to get lost in the shuffle of higher priced 22oz English bw - but it’s a solid, high quality Barleywine with a pleasing malt forward character. When seeking out English Barleywines you can’t go wrong with this choice. Drinking a March 2016 bottle, in March 2017 = smooth, sublime, delicious.

Pours deep amber, clear, tan low head. Fruity aroma, dry plums, cherries, some malts, honey, toast, alcohol. Medium sweetness, medium sourness, low bitterness. Medium body, supprisingly big carbonation, thick. Good price/quality ratio.
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Un barley wine très équilibré avec une belle amertume en final.

Kolor coś między bursztynem a burgundowym, klarowne, piany praktycznie nie ma. Pachnie czerwonymi owocami, rodzynkami, karmelem, drewnem. Świetny "słodki" aromat. W smaku, suszone owoce, karmel, czerwone jabłko, goryczka na finiszu. Jak dla mnie mógłby mieć mniejsze wysycenie, ale i tak jest spoko.

Bottle from Taniguchi. Served in my Anchor Steam glass it is a crystal clear ruby-amber-brown with a beige head. The aroma is stone fruit while the taste is raisins, figs, caramel wafers and toffee. A classic American barleywine that suits the season well.

Bottle 355ml. Clear dark ruby with minimal head. Rich aroma full of malts, toffee, honey and raisins. Really sweet with light bitterness. Alcohol is 
covered by sweet aroma. Good and rich barley wine, but was too sweet to me.

From 33cl bottle at Vor Bier&Bar, Gijón, Spain. Pours hazy orange brown with low foam. Aroma of rich in caramel, honey, dried fruits. Body is medium with low carbonation. Taste is mostly sweet, with nice bitterness coming through. Finish is moderately long.

Bottled at Clubhouse BFD bottling event. 2012 vintage. Pours ruby color, off white head. Aroma is vanilla, fig, cinnamon, some dark fruit, cherry, and citrus. Flavor is cherry, fig, plum, citrus rind with a bitter finish. Very full bodied. Never had this, but this 2012 vintage is excellent.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottle. Clear Ruby Red in colour. Very Malty; caramel, toffee, candy sugar, toasted bready malts, vanilla. Very fruity; citrus-orange, dark fruits. Hoppy; spicy, piney resinous hops. Sweet. Viscous, oily and slightly syrupy. Very smooth; not at all harsh; rather subtle. Beautiful malt/fruit/hop balance. Enjoyed this a lot. Nice beer! (2008)

A bottle from Privado in Guting, drunk at home. Aroma: lovely fruity cake [specifically Dundee...?] Appearance: clear, reddish brown, minimal tan lacing. Palate: medium-bodied, oily, soft carbonation, long fruity finish. Taste: extremely well balanced, not too sweet - a plus point for me - a quality product.

Bottle. Pours Amber with thick tan head. Aroma is sweet malty with dark fruits. Taste is sweet malty prune, cherry and plum notes with a sweet malty fruit finish. Wish i would have grabbed more of it now.

Bottle, 0.355l. Clear dark ruby pour with virtually no head. Rich on the nose; malty sweet, herbal, boozy, lots of caramel.

Medium to full body with slick and oily texture. Soft carbonation, quite lively on the tongue. Mostly sweet taste with a touch of alcohol bitterness. Aroma is heavy malt, caramel and toffee, brown sugar, liquor. Syrup. Herbal, bready. A bit peppery. Notable alcohol presence. Very rich, nicely balanced. Might be too sweet for some. Regular finish. Slight hops in the aftertaste, nice.

Overall, delicious.

Mooi diep amberkleurig bier met dikke romige crèmekleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan inzakt. Aroma en smaken van confituur, aardbei, beetje mout, ahornsiroop, kersen(likeur). Mooie warme, licht zoetige, afdronk. Zoet maar zeker niet té zoet, heel mooi in balans. Topper !!
Aromat toffi, karmelu i przypalonego tosta. W smaku klasyczne karmelowe barley wine, aczkolwiek z wytrawnym posmakiem owoców leśnych i ziołowoscia chmieli. Dobre klasyczne barley wine.

Bottle from la caisse de Bieres. Pours a very flat head with dense but elegant malts. Clear amber colored body. Nice density of round malts and blooming hops; not aggressive on alcohol or roasting. A easy drinking barley wine.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2004 bottle thanks to puzzl. Poured clear dark amber with no head. Aroma sweet caramel toffee burnt sugar. No carb med bod. Taste sweet juicy dark fruits
2004 bottle on NYE thanks to Charule. Pours a clear Amber golden brown. No head. Completely flat. Aroma is oxidation and dark fruits. Tastes caramel.

Dark amber with medium head. Aroma: cookies, malt, pineapple, some caramel. Taste is moderately sweet with medium body and bitterness, some metallic notes, probably from hops. Surprisingly drinkable and well balanced but less complex than i expected.

35,5cl bottle at home. Appearance: dark amber with low, off-white head. Aroma: caramel, raisins, banana. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of caramel, raisins and some spice. Palate: medium bodied, sticky texture and medium carbonation. A bit to sugarry. Not much else to distinguish.
Honey,rich malt character,complex sweetness,full body,caramel.There is some bitterness but overall sweet.Maybe a little bit more on the sweet side.

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988 for the motherfucking book. Sigh. The pour is a darker ruby colored light brown with a thinner colored light tan head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is really sweet. There is a lot of caramel and a light fruitiness about it. This isn’t really like any other Barleywine that I’ve had. There is almost a sweet potato thing happening and a strong brown sugar. The flavor is very similar. It’s not the best thing by any means. Lots of sweet molassess and sweet sugar without a lot or malt shining through. This is really interesting, but not that good. The mouth feel is thin and watery with a lack of carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and sugary finish. This isn’t that great at all. Damn book.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is caramel, toffee, sweet, some pine, booze, eh. Appearance is reddish brown, clear, light brown head. Taste is caramel, toffee, some pine, sweet, brown sugar maybe, different. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, caramel aftertaste. Overall, different. Drinkable but not great.

Czerwonawe, rubinowe z przeciętną białą pianą, ulatnia się dość szybko. Zapach złożony, wyraźne estry, trochę landrynki, cukier, kwiaty, melasa, toffi, trochę chleba. W smaku jest bardzo zbalansowane i dość grzeczne, spokojne, nic nie wyrywa z butów, goryczka dość niska. Słodkie, wyklejające aczkolwiek nie do przesady, pełne, wysycenie niskie. Bardzo delikatne rozgrzewanie. Złożone i przyjemne, ale brakuje jakiejś kontry, czegoś charakterystycznego.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Lovely Barley variant! Very sweet and syroppy, but also a IPA-flavour to it.

I bought this bottle at Amstein, St-Légier. I drank it yesterday at home. I was tired but it is the kind of beer that you become again happy in this unfair life. The color is copper/orange, middle/low carbonation, thin foam. The taste is perfect, powerful at the tongue and through the throat. It is malty, grape sugar, caramel, plum, some cynamon and there is a nice touch of hop at the final and we don’t have this impression to get 8.8 degrees of alcohol.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled 3/27/2013. Pours lightly hazy deep reddish copper color with a nice 1 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big raisin, plum, cherry, fig, apricot, apple, date, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted brown bread, light molasses, herbal, floral, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, cherry, fig, apricot, apple, date, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted brown bread, light molasses, herbal, floral, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, cherry, fig, apricot, apple, date, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted brown bread, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and light earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a creamy and slightly slick/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming lingering after the finish. Overall this is an excellent English barleywine! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
BOTTLE. Crimson pour with quick fading head.. Sweet toffee, malt & candy nose.. Sweet caramel/toffee malt throughout, some heavy hop bitterness in middle, finishing almost as fruit cake.. Sourced RW

Pours amber brown with medium large beige head. Aroma is caramel, yeast, raisins, bread. Medium full body. A minor alcohol presence. Flavor is quite tasty up front, sweet bread and dried fruits and caramel. Unfortunately the finish does not quite live up, somewhat less complex and harsher. Nonetheless quite good.
Mocno miedziana barwa. Piana niska i szybko ulatująca choć to raczej normalne w tym stylu. Aromat słodowy. Delikatna goryczka. Super zalepek. Fajne piwo do sączenia na jesienne wieczory
Bottle. Pours dark, cloudy orange. Smells of sweet caramel, malt, fruit. Sweet, heavy taste, medium bitterness. Very good and a well done barley. Enjoyable.

Dark red. Rich aroma and flavour, with malt, caramel, fruity esters and spicy hops. Full, sweet taste, and a dry finish with low bitterness and a bit of alcohol. Full and rounded body. Overall, a great barley wine. Beautiful, rich, tasty, harmonic, and very drinkable. Not cloying at all.
One of my favorite beer! Pours gold colour beer with a medium head. Well-balanced!

Belle couleur brune/orange, belle mousse qui finit sur un léger col persistant. Au nez, ça schmeck principalement le pruneau et le fruit sec. Pas excessivement sucrée en bouche, pas très amère, pas trop alcoolisée, arômes portées sur la prune et les fruits secs, un peu sur la peau d’orange amère. Une barley qui ne va pas dans l’excès et qui se boit bien.

Magnifique robe cuivrée, mousse minimale. Nez caramel, toffee, fruits confits, prune, liqueur. La bouche est sucrée et amère, toffee, marmelade, prune, finale sur des houblons herbeux. Le corps est liquoreux et dense, la longueur interminable. Fabuleuse bière, chaleureuse, un vrai régal.

0.355 l bottle from ’REWE Budnik & Homberg’ at 9.4% abv, best before August 2016, presumably two years old. Clear, dark mahogany with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity aroma of caramel, molasses, raisins, prunes and a touch of licorice. Very sweet, malty and moderately fruity taste of caramel, molasses, raisins, prunes, candied cherries, figs and some licorice, followed by a long, quite bitter, rather warming, pleasantly alcoholic finish. Medium body, slightly oily and a bit effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Heavy, moreish and intense but quite well-balanced and tasty brew, maybe a bit too alcoholic. Should be a good winter warmer, and it held up very well in the cellar!

- schöne rot-braune Farbe mit leichter Schaumbildung
- sehr schöne Aromen nach Malz und Trockenobst machen sich
 in der Nase breit
- die Kohlensäure ist für diesen Stil passend dosiert
- geschmacklich ist alles in harmonischer Balance 
- Hopfen, Malz und süße Früchte stehen in perfektem Einklang
- selbst der Alkohol hält sich dezent im Hintergrund
- im Abgang gewinnt der Hopfen dann leicht die Oberhand und 
 ruft einem in Erinnerung, dass es sich hier um ein Bier handelt
Fazit: Ein fantastisches Barley Wine mit einem sensationellen
Preis- / Leistungsverhältnis

33cl bottle. Wow. Peaches, fresh apricots, caramel, vanilla, pears, watermelon, raisins. Pours a deep garnet with a frothy off white head. A full body with a sticky mouthfeel. Very smooth and complex. Top 5 for sure.

Bottle 355 ml. Amber color. Aroma: floral, fruit, a bit of citrus, raisins, dried apricots, sweet white wine. Taste: sweetest nectar, maple syrup, candies, toffee, raisins, candied fruits, jellies, sweet white port wine and orange peel.

Thick dark amber brew... very short lasting off white/yellow head and almost no lacing.

Aroma is toward the malt side of things .. caramel and toffee with only slight whiffs of citrusy hops.

Dark malt flavors mingle well with caramel ... very light dried fruit and more hop flavor than the aroma. Mouthfeel is on the light side for West Coast Barlewines... Carbonation is light but everpresent.
Aroma: Floral, licorice, red berries, roast malts Appearance: Brown, amber, clear, low carb,light beige head, medium lace, Taste: Licorice, chocolate, wood, roast, sly dry sweet bitter finish

33cl bottle at home. Pours a mahogany colour with an off-white head which rapidly diminishes to a creamy layer. Aroma of candy sugar, caramel, prunes, alcohol, malt, plums. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a warming finish. Notes of caramel, plums, candy sugar, coffee, cocoa beans, strawberry. Texture is syrupy, medium to full bodied with low carbonation.

Piwo bardzo ułożone.Klasyczny profil słodowy, przyjemne toffi w smaku. Nic tu nie wystaje. Po prostu pije się normalnie, bez zachwytu, ale z przyjemnością. Bardzo proste piwo. Chyba tak ma to wyglądać.

Clear deep amber with a nice steady dark tan head. Strong aroma of toffee, toast, dried fruits, spice, hints of chocolate and strawberry and resin. Strong sweetness is almost matched by bitterness and acidity. Body is lighter than expected, nice round alcoholic warmness. Very palatable. Dangerous!

355ml at the Head of Steam, Durham. Dark amber with virtually no head. Sharp aroma, almost vinegar-like, with a curious hint of tequila. Faint herbal flavour, with tannic and decayed floral notes; somewhat cloying.
Bottle, 355 ml, courtey of and shared with JFK10000. Pours unclear orange, small beige head. Malty, dried fruit, toffee, spices. Quite sweet with bittersweet finish. Full bodied.
Some fruits like dried apricot and plums. Taste is just a bitter-sweet mess! Second swing and a miss from Anchor for me.

Ruby colour, clear, almost no head, high (too high) carbonation. Vety weak aroma: some malty notes, cereal. Full body, heavy cloying sweetness, Flavour sweet malty, some dry fruits. Bit of alcohol on finish, but also nice hoppy bitterness and flavour.

Bottle. Almost no head but very strong carbonation, dark amber. Big malty, fruity, caramel and toast flavor, a bit alcoholic. Sweet and medium bitter. Maybe a bit too much bitter for me in that type (barleywine), but I think it?s classical for American Barleywine. But when it?s malty, I prefer it not too bitter.
Brownish pour with minimal head. Aroma is sweet dark fruit and some floral i did not expect in a barley wine. Taste followed nose less the floral. Minimal alcohol and not sticky at all.

Dark ruby color cleer beer, low tanned head. 
Very sweet, caramely aroma. Caramel, hint of red wine, toffe, molasses
Taste: high sweet, light bitter. Caramel, hint of toffe, hint of wine, hint of something like iron? (again). 
Palate: medium body as for barley wine. Low carbonated. Not as sticky as I’m used to with barley wines. Well hidden alcohol.
Overall: pretty classic barley wine. Good, but expected more.

G: Nice/Barrel/Wein/Hopfen/Americano T: Süß/Schmeichelend/Malz/Hops/Low Alcohol Taste NH: Nicht sehr lang, dafür aber ausgewogen und sehr rund. Der Barley Wine für die Grillparty ;). 355ml Flasche von BEYOND BEER in HH. 4-5 Euro.

dark brown, rather clear, minimal foam; caramel, dark fruits, some spices? and alcohol; medium+ sweetness and bitterness; full body, quite thick feel, softly carbonated, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very nice sipper, balanced, well-made, no flaws

Typical american barleywine. Heavy innthr malts, sweet, well hopped and thick. Well balanced. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.355 bottle. Clear, brown color with a crimson tinge and a small, off-white head. The aroma is composed primarily of dark fruits, caramel, and figs with a malty backbone. Taste is also relatively fruity, caramel features prominently again, sugar and raisins make a first appearance. A full body, a creamy texture, and an average carbonation. The finish introduces molasses and is a tad off with its bitterness level; after such an intro I expected something better. Overall the beer is good, obviously it does have shortcomings but let that not overshadow its merits.
Brun/röd med stort smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar russin, och torkad frukt. Bra öl!

Bottle. Dark amber color with minimal head. Aroma has dark fruits, some alcohol and caramel. Taste is sweet fruity with long nice aftertaste that has some minor bitterness. Flavors of caramel, dark fruits, berries, raisins. Smooth and tasty one.

How: Bottle.

Where: Systembolaget.

Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.

Aroma: Malt, dried fruit, alcohol, raisin, caramel.

Body: Full body, low carbonation.

Flavour: Dried fruit, alcohol, caramel, raisin, plum.

Amber and somewhat hazy with a creamy off-white head. Complex aroma with subtle notes of bananas, pears and sugar cookies. Full-bodied with a sweet, complex character. 3 years old and the hops have really mellowed. Delicious.

Bottle
Aroma-floral, fruits, alcohol
Appearance-ruby, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Barwa rubinowa, klarowne. Piana opada do obrączki, piwo pięknie oblepia szkło. Zapach kokosowy, waniliowy, nie za wyraźny. W smaku doskonałe, 33,3% goryczka, 33,3% słodowość, 33,3% kwaskowość, świetnie zbilansowane.
Bottle from dusty...decent taste....not as much caramel as normal...good but not great...

Caramel brown..decent 1 finger head..nose is figs,honey, molasses, trace of teriyaki sauce..mouthfeel is alright with some full coating and warmth from the almost 9 percent.honey n booze comes through the most here.quite smooth and decadent
Barley wine bastante bueno. Cuerpo medio. Poco gas. Tiene un aroma que tira a dulce, igual que el sabor que deja al final.

355ml bottle at abv 10% bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.



Looks: Translucent amber brown colour with bits of yeast particles; Less than one-quarter finger head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 15 seconds; Good good sticky lacing with zero carbonation.



Aroma: Fragrant and sweet Amber malt, with strong alcohol, moderate Brandy, strong plums, dark fruits, caramel, strong toffee, floral, sugar, earth, spices, yeast and light lemon.



Taste: Mid to strong sweet full Ale malt, with strong caramel, very strong sticky toffee, dark fruits, alcohol, fair liquorices, floral, sugar, spices, lemon, quite strong bitter hops and grass.



Body: Full body. Thick and smooth palate.



Mouth Feel: Rich Amber maltyness in a fairly oily but smooth background. Strong sweet sticky toffee up front with strong plums and assorted darks fruits. Very sweet but not cloying. Good floral with notable spices. lemon to round. Kinda simple but very nice! 



Booze: At abv 10% it’s alcoholic but not abrasive, only slightly Brandy-like with very low knock-on. Excellent!



Hoppiness: Floral, earth, spices, and light lemon in nose, and the same but stronger in taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, close to high astringent sweet bitter malty finish.



Taste: Fairly dry. Sweet, boozy and bitter to mouth.



Comments: As Barley Wine, this one fits all the attributes as rich, smooth, toffee-ish, alcoholic, dark fruity and sweet. What’s more, it’s also finely tuned with moderate liquor-ish taste (much lesser than most Strong Belgian Ambree), nice sweetness, and smart spicy citrusy hoppiness. Very suitable for beginners of the style as well as tasters. A very nice sipper to have!
Turbid brown/red with creamy off white head. Really nice roasted malt and caramel aroma. Smooth taste with a lot of malt sweetness and a well balanced alcohol warm feeling. Very good barley wine.

355ml bottle. Clear dark red with two finger beige head. Aroma of pine cones, caramel, rich malts, toffee, grapefruit, citrus and slightly burnt brown sugar. Taste is warming with rich malts, caramel, dried fruits, faint pine and grapefruit, citrus and lightly roasted coffee. Medium yet incredibly smooth mouthfeel, light carbonation and filling slightly roasted caramel aftertaste.

Riktigt tjusig rödaktig, nästan lite hallonfärgad, klar vätska med fluffigt beiget skum som lämnar rester på sidorna. Nötig, brödsirap, lönnsirap, maltsötma men även ett lätt humlebett. Något större kropp, lätt bubblig. Smak av kola, lönnsirap, torkad frukt som avslutas i fint humlebett som balanserar upp sötman fint. Även lätt strävhet av ekfat i avslutningen. En fin, något lättare barley wine som ändå behåller tyngden.
Pours hazy brown with a thin line of white head. Aroma; dades, figs, dried dark fruits, vanilla, some booze and caramel. Taste; Dried dark fruits, figs, vanilla, caramel and malt.

Świetne piwo. Ma przyjemny aromat owoców z odrobiną wanilii w tle. Wygląd jest ok - fajna barwa i słaba piana. Smak natomiast to największa zaleta tego piwa - jest mega pijalne i świetnie zbalansowane. Sięgnę po nie jeszcze nie raz...

Pours clear deep ruby with a small tight dark cream head fading to a film. Aroma of caramel, overripe apple and pear, dried berries, marzipan, a bit of fruitcake/nuts. Palate rather sweet with layers of caramel, candied apple, raisins and other dried berries, toasted nuts, Bristol Cream. Finish dries slightly with alcohol heat and a touch of bittering hops. Medium bodied, slick, quite soft carbonation. Drinks more in the English style compared to modern heavily hopped barley wines, it’s smooth and well balanced though not so punchy. Must have been quite something when first debuted though.
Sötaktig och knäckig, torkad frukt och viss syrlighet från citrus. Medelbeska.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours Brown with dark beige head. Caramell and fruits both in smell and taste. Quite sweet. The fruit comes forward more at the end.

Flasche (355 cl) vom Bierzwerg. - Goldbraun, leicht trüb. - In der Nase harziger IPA-Hopfen über schwerem Karamelmalz. - Antrunk schwer toastmalzig-süß aber nicht klebrig sondern komplementär ergänzt durch kräftige aber runde aromatische Hopfenbittere: bittere Orangenmarmelade, zarte Tabaknote, etwas Harz. Nur mild rezent, sehr schwer, fast ölig, mit deutlichem aber gut eingebundenem Alkohol (Anklänge an Weinbrand). - Schön malzig-schweres Starkbier mit sehr aromatischer „amerikanischer“ Hopfung, enorm rund und weich trotz stattlichen Ethanolgehalts. Große Klasse!

Közepes, tartós, sűrű bézs hab, félbarna szín. Ilata nem túl markáns, maláta, citrus és némi karamell keveredik benne. Íze édes égetett cukorral és némi alkoholossággal indít, majd karamell és pici citrus bújik elő, a komló keserűjével karöltve. Szénsavas, de még nem pezsgős. Utóíze enyhén kesernyés, inkább némi konyakosság az uralkodó. Testes, nehéz sör.

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy ruby colour with a medium, short lived, tan head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of overripe fruit, caramel malt and alcohol. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, overripe fruit, brown sugar, light spice and warming alcohol with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with a thick, oily texture and soft carbonation. Pretty nice.

Pours a lovely dark amber colour with a tan head. Malty hoppy aroma with hints of dark fruits and caramel. Sweet malty fruity hoppy flavor with hints of caramel. Warming malty and bitter aftertaste. A nice barley wine.
Glowing Amber off white pillowy head looks great in the glass rich mouthfeel sherry marzipan Christmas pudding would go great with a cigar nicely done.

Botella, @La Barrica 13, Candas, 16/03/16. BBD:06/2017
Color ámbar, sabor caramelo, dulce, cuerpo medio, alto.

355ml bottle into an ’Arrogant Bastard Ale’ glass at home on 6th March 2016. Lightly tanned foam blanket sat on top of a deep red body. Malty nose and front, sweet molasses rule this beer although there is a distinct hop twang to the brew as well. Most enjoyable, my sweet tooth liking this very much. Rich, deep, wine like depth to the body and texture, pleased I managed to try it at last (been looking for some time).
Bottle shared at home. Dark amber colour with a small white head. Nose is strong raisin with some zest. Taste is mild sweetness with torokmez, kakasosnyaloka and selyemcukor. Sry..
Bottle from Jane’s Beer Store, Mountain View. Caramel and raisin aroma. Buttery caramel taste. Good.
