27-Feb-2016-0,33L Flasche @ MühlenBar. Kupferrot, klar, cremefarbener Schaum. Aroma : Malzig, Toffee, Rosinen. Antrunk Malzig, Trockenpflaume, gegen Ende leicht zitrisch. Gut.

12 ounce bottle poured into a tulip glass. The beer is a dark mahogany color with a thick head of beige foam. Strong retention. The aroma has nuts, molasses, fig, and raisin. Fairly sweet with a lot of dark fruit character going on. The molasses is near a horehound note. Some woody notes do come through as well. Thick mouthfeel with soft, subtle carbonation. Big body. Delicious beer.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy darker amber with small yellow head. Aroma: caramel, toffee, hay, rasin, candys, acetone. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, caramel, toffee, candy, brown sugar, wine tones, Medium to full body. Sweet finish. Easy to drink. Nice one.

butelka, warka do 6 2017. bursztynowe, z niewysoka, ale bardzo ladna, gesta, kremowa piana. aromaty... o dziwo na przedzie mocne, owocowe estry, glownie ananas, pomarancza, figi, jakies tropiki. czuc tez ewidentnie ta cukierkowo-chlebowo-toffi slodycz charakterystyczna dla stylu. brzmi to niby prosto, ale i jedna i druga warstwa bardzo zlozona, fajnie grajaca ze soba. W ustach jest geste, lepkie, troche syropowe, ewidentnie slodkie i - tu zaskoczenie dla mnie - tez ewidentnie kwaskowate. o dziwo - dosc rzeskie, nie to moze, zeby pic jedno po drugim, pod rzad, ale jednak szybko znikajace z pokala. goryczka nie jakas duza, ale wystarczajaca, by kontrowac slodkosci roznorakie. oczywiscie w trakcie picia, w smaku czuc rowniez to, co w aromatach. ewidentnie super piwo, sprostalo swojej badz co niebadz klasycznej legendzie.

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle, 12 fl oz, O’Connor’s, Uppsala. Decent, sweet, smooth, little carbonation.

WYGLĄD: Barwa miedziana, klarowne. Piana drobna, wysoka, trwała. Pięknie zdobi szkło.

AROMAT: Intensywny. Karmel wymieszany z czerwonymi owocami (żurawina, borówka, porzeczka, czereśnie). W tle nuty ziołowe.

SMAK: Absolutna dominacja karmelu. Nieznaczny posmak owoców. Goryczka średnia, krótka. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, delikatnie rozgrzewający przełyk. Odczucie "zaklejania ust".

OGÓLNIE: Zacny klasyk. Nie zawiódł moich oczekiwań. Ponadczasowy Barley Wine.
Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Clear Amber with small beige head. Aroma is caramel malt, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt.

Truly an American classic. Deep garnet pour with a minimal eggshell colored head. Lots of fruity esters, caramel for days, cake, earthy hops, touch of booze. Flavors were full of dark fruit, caramel, cherries, roasted nuts. Lingering bittersweet finish with a viscous and slick mouthfeel. Super balanced, slight heat in the finish, sweetness held in check. So good. Can’t imagine the response when this was first brewed. Classic.
Strutturata e luppolata, ma mette in risalto la dolcezza dei malti. Aromi di frutta, calda e pastosa.

It pours out with a substantial head, and has a dark amber colour. The Aroma is dense with the malt notes leading to a fruity spice at the end. Texture is silky smooth, like velvet or good champagne. Perfect carbonation and excellent mouth feel.

Taste is complex and rather interesting. Perhaps a little intense over the bottle but at first you get a wonderful depth of flavors. From the alcohol content at the front followed by a treacle finish. Maybe a little on the sweet side. Its not perfectly balance although some dry hops come through.

It has a wonderful kick and excellent alcohol warmth. This is a very good beer and excellent value. A bottle is plenty enough though. I would share it.

Bottled, 355ml, aged 6.5yrs from York Beer & Wine, York. Amber to copper with off white head. This proved to be a smooth, rich and luscious beer that had aged really well. Certainly wine like in a rum soaked dark prune like way, warming with just a hint of caramelisation towards the back of the palate. Some sweetness, but just enough. There are malt biscuit and old leather notes. Oh yes, very good.

Sympathique petite barleywine avec des notes de miel, caramel, prune et une amertume assez légère. La consistance est un peu huileuse ce qui en fait une bière relativement lourde (classique pour une barleywine). Peu de bulles et une relativement bonne longueur en bouche. Assez agréable dans l’ensemble.

0,33l bottle. Dark copper colour with quickly disappearing tan head. Aroma: Honey, walnut, almond with nutmeg, vanilla and caramel. Complex. You can smell it from a distance. Taste: Has a full malty start with spicey pastry tones, with very slight tarty vibe and a green/hoppy/bitter mouthfeel. Has a warming liquorish tone but fresh at the same time. Medium/full body, medium carbonation. Long bitter and sweet finish. Very good barley wine.

Bottle. Pours a rich ruby red with a fading off white bubbly head. Aroma of red fruits, raspberries, strawberries, pine, caramel. Taste is of pine, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, red fruits, burnt bitter finish. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle 0,355l. Dark redish color with a big foamy top. Caramel, light roast, sweetness in the aroma. Taste has notes of fruits and light bitterness at finish. Full body mouthfeel. Really enjoyed this one!

335ml bottle. dark brown with ruby reflections, big tan head. 
sweet plums and medical alcohol aroma.
taste of plum’s liquor with roast malty dry final. sweet fruity hops aftertaste.
full body, oily texture.

Ok this is a great intro to barley wines for the uneducated. You get the ale with a hint of prune. It's as if I ate an ale soaked prune. Good stuff. Not strong. Not boozy. Definitely not over powering. Like I stated a great intro to the style. Barley wines can be too boozy and hot and dried fruit like. This is not any of that. It is pooping the cherry of an ale drinker to the barley wine style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy mahogany brown color, beige head. Caramel syrup nose, wood, fruity notes. Heavy sweet taste, caramel, malty, alcohol, hint of grass. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Too boozy and sweet.

Bottle. Clear beautiful ruby red color, thin fine head. Full nose, first sweet malt, heavy caramel, then some fruity estery notes, bubblegum, wow. Balanced taste, sweet but with a ethanol counterpart, light sourness and light bitter. Malty, warm aftertaste. Full body, low carbonation.
Pours a cloudy bourbon color with a rich, smooth beige head. Fruity, toffee, somewhat alcoholic nose. Moderately thick with some gaseous carbonation. Circus peanut fruitiness with toffee flavors.

Kolor: miedziany, klarowny.

Piana: obfita: drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała.

Zapach: słodowy, karmelowy, likierowy, chmielowy, owocowy, żywiczny, aromaty ciemnych owoców.

Smak: pełne, aksamitne, spora słodowość, likierowość, nuty ciemnych owoców, karmelu, melanoidyn, goryczka w kirunku niskiej.

Wysycenie: w kierunku niskiego.

Butelka 0,355l Kolor bursztynowy z błyskami rubinowymi, piana średnia, ładnie się trzyma. Aromat słodowy, cytrusy i owoce. Smak whisky, karmelu i owoców z przewagą cytrusów.Łagodny alkohol i dobre nagazowanie, aromat i goryczka wzorcowe. Super piwo.

Rating #1425 - 31.12.2014 - Beer #7 in @beerblast #Beermas. Nut brown pour, bubbly head, not much lacing. Aroma is a cascadey punch, alcohol, pastry dough Taste is an alcoholic blast, lots of hoppy bitterness tempered with a ton of citrusy, malty sweetness on the palate. Just a big bold beer for flavour-lovers. Awesome.
Bottle - Vintage 2011 - Nice caramel sweetness with some sweetness. Clearish copper with a beige head. Sweet, caramel, lightly oxidized and fruity. A bit thin, but nice.
Ouwe touwen en teer in de zon op ’t dek van een ouwe trekschuit. Backlog from 2015/04/06.
Full flavored with a clear dominance of syrup and malty sweetness with hints of dark chocolate.

Bottle. Clear dark brown colour and a relatively stable off-white head. Aroma rich malty, toasted and nutty with some dried fruits and esters. Very balanced in taste, showing rich malty character combining with citrusy piney hoppiness, all in bold intensity. Easy drinking with alcohol hidden well. Very good.

Aroma:


Sweet, belgian yeast, ripe fruit, malts.




Appearance:


Turbid amber/brown beer with a medium thick off-white head.




Taste/Palate:


Slightly sweet and very fruity, intense hops and mild spices.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared bottle. Pours is clear amber with thick persistent white head. Aroma of grapes, spruce, caramel, floral and sweet, barrique very promising. Taste is medium sweet, some bitter notes, carmel and grapes on tongue. Heavy body, oily texture, flat carbonation, light long bitter and heavy sweet finish. Overally bit sweet but awesome and well ballanced beer anyway. I’m not a big fan of anchor brewery but this one is superb.

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear deep amber colour with a thin off white head. Aroma of molasses, toffee, fruitcake, a little liquorice, some raisin, slight prune, subtle orange, slight brown sugar, maybe whisky and spicy hops. Taste of molasses, toffee, fruitcake, raisin, some prune, slight brown sugar, whisky, a little vanilla, orange, liquorice and spicy hops. Full bodied and a sticky texture. A warming, spicy, toffee finish. An extremely complex, flavourful beer. Like a whisky or a brandy more than a beer. A gorgeous, warming barley wine overall.

In short: drinkable cake beer.
Aroma: tarta, pie, plum and peach,
Appearance: dark orange, with creamy foam.
Taste: medium sweet and very light bitter and sour.
Palate: grass/citronella finish.

Big frothy and beige head, slowly diminishing until it disappears. Clear reddish (ruby) dark amber. Complex, sweet aroma (candy sugar), very ripe fruit (apricot and citrus), spicy with some hoppynes. It tastes sweet (molasses), warm, ripe fruit (prune), toasted malt, wine wort and hoppy with a spicy and bitter fruityness finish. Medium carbonation. A very enjoyable discovery for me!

Mörkt rödbrun med medelstort skum. Fantastisk doft med stor maltighet, fikon dadlar och russin, pomerans och apelsin, kryddor. Smaken är rik och fyllig med sötma från torkade frukter - dadlar, fikon russin - fruktighet av apelsin och pomerans och en skön kryddighet, liten eldighet och allt avslutas med en liten väl balanserad beska.

En toppen-barley wine, smakrik och välbalanserad och alldeles underbar.

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 07 2017 Pours clear amber red to brown liquid, medium frothy tan head, Aroma: candied fruits, sweet, malty, cane sugar, caramel, whiskey, wooden notes, red fruits, citrus, warming alcohol, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, citrus, lemon grass, orange, peach, raisins, caramel, Palate: medium to heavy body, oily mouthfeel, average carbonation, long sweet warming aftertaste, Overall: excelent beer, enjoyed.

330 mL bottle. Generally clear deep amber pour with some residue floating about. Tall foamy, pale beige head, good retention. Malt aroma, toffee, brown sugar, spiciness, rum, some alcohol. Taste follow with the malt theme of course, sweet, rich, warming. Slightly sticky body, minimal carbonation.

pours a dark copper with a medium tan head. aroma is caramel malt with a hint of floral hops. thick heavy mouth feel. taste is rich toasted malt, then a light hop bitter. Long warming finish with a little bitter linger. Good strong beer.

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra, Tiel.
Hazy light brown with an off-white head. Malty aroma with some hops. Malty and fruity taste. Slightly boozy which also gives some alcohol warmth. Great beer.

Colore marrone, schiuma cremosa.
Odore fruttato, malto caramellato, liquoroso, pere, fichi, frutta matura.
Sapore dolce, caramellato, fruttato; liquorosa, corposa, calda; finale amaro a smorzare il dolce, che rimane il sapore predominante. Da meditazione.

- A naughty Granny’s dream: good blend of rum baba, caramel and high alcohol.
- Nose: Slightly bready/salty caramel; rum baba cake, amplified by mucho alcohol.
- Body: sweet. 
- Finish: sweetish, with a little hop; not sure if slightly underweight for ~9%, or if just nicely balanced.

Bottle shared pours a dark orange with off white head. The aroma is dark fruits, biscuits, toffee, sweet malts. The flavor is medium to heavy sweet malts with dark fruit notes a bready biscuit flavor and toffee, solid all the way around. Not as rich and deep as done others but very good.

Nez assez houblonné pour une barley wine, fond fumé, peu de caramel.
En bouche : plutôt légère, sensation lactée, petite rondeur plutôt subtile. Fond houblonné genre dry-hopping (herbal).
À 8,8% abv, et vu ces caractéristiques, est-ce encore une barley wine ?

Bottle - A bit hazy, deep copper colour with lacing, creamy tan head. Mostly malty sweetness in the nose, toffee, biscuts, red fruits and resinous hops. Taste of caramel, honey, oak, dried plum with rich malty notes. Resinous hoppy tase in the finish. Full body, thick texture, average carbonation, slight alcohol warmth. Massive, comlex barleywine, highly recommended.

0.355l bottle. Clear ruby body with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, reisins, orange peel and booze. Taste of caramel, orange zest, reisins, plums, booze and floral hops. Nice beer, but the alcohol could be a bit less obvious.
Amber coloured beer with off-white head. Aroma of caramel and toffee. Taste of molasses, sweet malt and pine hops.

Bottle shared at Leighton’s place. 25/08/2015. Thanks to Leighton. Clear reddy / amber coloured pour with a halo of off white head. Aroma is sweet toffee, mint apple, toffee. Palate is medium sweet, full airy carbonation, velvety. Flavour is composed of medium sweet, full layered sugars, toffee and dried apple, , pine needle hops, nice and chewy. Lovely barley wine.
Clear amber with a very fluffy vanishing head. Caramel, toffee. Very sweet and brandy like. Too sweet.

Piana skromna, po chwili brak :P
Barwa ciemny bursztyn, zmętnione, spora ilość drobinek, pochodzenia białkowego.

Aromat słodki, słodowy, karmelowo/toffi, jest dużo owoców, ciemnych owoców, ale jest też odrobinę pomarańczowe i brzoskwiniowe.


W smaku jest alkohol, rozgrzewający przełyk i poniżej aż do żołądka, ale jest to bardzo miłe uczucie. Jest słodkie, owocowe, lekko winne ale słodko winne, później słodowe, chlebowe, karmelowe.

Wysycenie średnie, pełne jak cholera, można wręcz gryźć, oleiste, goryczka średnia z owocowo alkoholowym finiszem.
Nicht besonders intensives Aroma nach Alkohol, Malz und ganz schwach nach Lösungsmittel. Geschmack auch relativ alkoholisch und vergleichsweise bitter.
Farbe braun und kaum durchsichtig. Geruchlich eher unauffällig. Im Geschmack süß und bitter. Mit Noten nach Pfirsich und Kirschen.

2010 bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours clear deep red - brown with a thick beige head. The nose is bitter-sweet, oily, toffee, fruit cake, light spice, candied peel, stewed orange, honeysuckle and peach. The taste is rich, bitter - sweet, toasty, varnish, piney wood, peach, nectarine, tangy marmalade, light alcohol boost, tannins, fruit cake and leather with a slick finish. Medium - full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Great balance and high drinkability. Very tasty indeed.

Bottle shred in London - sourced from the Euston Tap. Vintage 2010. Pours a compelling clear copper with a creamy tan head. There’s a hearty dose of pine in the nose, dried citrus, orange, crusty bread. Medium sweet flavor with some graham crackers, ripe berries, oily pine, a bit of toffee, orange peel. Full bodied with fine carbonation. A little chewy. Warming finish, oily, with rich citrus, light earthy and piney bitterness, toasty bread. Solid.
Malt, candy, spices, caramel. alcohol, sweet. A very easy drinking barley wine with full body and a long finish. Very long.
Bottle. Amber colour, clear. Aroma caramel, salty, nuts, mollasses, hops. Taste sweet, caramel red fruits, mollases. Alcohol in taste. Good one.
Bottle from hop hideout, sheffield. ruby red with a white head. Aroma is fig and cola. Taste is sweet and bitter. Full bodied with oily mouthfeel and mild carbonation.

W aromacie suszone owoce, śliwki, karmel, typowy BW. Barwa bursztynowa, ale pływa sporo brzydkich farfocli. Piana niewielka, chociaż jak na BW to średnia. W smaku także suszone owoce i karmel, ale jest też kontra chmielowa, jest zauważalna goryczka miedzy niskim a średnim poziomem, odczucie w ustach średnie ku pełnemu, wysycenie średnie (jak na BW, to ku wysokiemu). Rzeczywiście bardzo dobry balans między słodyczą a goryczką i chmielowością. Bardzo dobre, ale nie wybitne. Jednakże przy swojej cenie i dostępności - na pewno warto.
Drank with Liedewij while talking 11-8-2015. Liked this beer very much. It is quite rich. It grabs you and does not let go. Very sweet, alcohol, complex and compelling. Liked it very much.

Kopparfärgad med ett stort skum som sakta sänker sig. Sötsyrliga toner i både doft och smak. Skulle legat till sig, är nu lite stickig

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught. Pours amber with creme head. Aroma of malts, caramel, pine, flowers. In taste sweet, caramel and malty with hoppy notes. Full bodied, strog bitterness in the finish. Solid classic BW.

Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Brown-redish, muddy color. Beige head. Smell of sweet malts, dark fruits, liquorice. Taste is slightly metallic, dark berries, sweet, malty, plums, boozy. Definitely a lot of alcohol. Good beer.

Drink cold: 8-10°C
Eye: pours a murky amber to ruby color with a rather quickly dissipating beige head and medium carbonation.
Nose: fruity licorice. Prunes and red grapes and different berries. Almost a bit belgian style like; caramel and/or maple-syrup
Mouth: a hint of carbonation, foamy and a bit metallic and a potpurri of fruits/berries (fruitcake or tarte)
Palate: yeasty, sweet licorice, sweets, nuts, cranberry and pomegranate
Overall: plus: very drinkable and as enjoyable as a belgian beer; downside: a bit metallic or alcoholic in the taste.
Amber, moderate head. Nose of syrup, resin, grass. Medium to full body. Sweet taste of roasted malt, a bit of booze, winy, light bitterness along. Well balanced. Nice brew.

Poured from the 6-pack, look is reddish orange nice 2-3 finger collar. The first beer and a half are forced sippers, meaning it is almost impossible to gulp, but after that all bets are off. I got all kinds of different flavors in every drink: fresh fruit, dried fruit, sugar, booze, malt and some hops. I also get why the commercial description suggests to sip after dinner, because it’s strong! I wouldn’t suggest trying to drink all 6 if you have anything to do the next day, especially early in the morning.

Bottle. Pours Reddish Amber with a very small, beige head. Aroma of malt soup. Notes of stone fruit and booze. Lots going on in the taste. Plummy fruit, liquor and a bit of doughy cake flavour. Gets you pished n’aw. Tidy.

Orange-red with thin beige head. A bit hazy. 
Wood, fruit, alcohol, apricots, chocolate, hops and a bit of liquorice in the nose.
Bitter and fresh flavour with notes of fruit, vanilla and chocolate. Somewhat sweet with a dry finish.

A really beautiful reddish brown ale with light foam. Even when the bottle is opened spreads a lovely winey aroma. There is much fruit in the aroma and slightly malt. The palate is marked by hard roasted malt and lots of fruit. The alcohol has a nice warming effect and edge makes a good vinous fullness. The finish is long and the hops gives it a subtle bitter touch which is in a very good balance with the malty and fruity taste.
This one has a lot going for it. Looks good. Smells good. Tastes good. Definitely recommend it.

Grumligt orange/mörkbrun med kvarhållande beigt skum. Doftar sött, lite kanel och kryddor. Smaken omedelbart sötsyrlig, maltig med lite beska i botten. Eftersmaken ganska lång: lite sötsliskig, mycket tung maltsmak. Klart bästa Barley wine jag druckit.

A- In my opinion it has a very alcoholic smell to it. I can smell a little bit of the dark fruit but mostly alcohol. A- Nice ruby color with an off white head that leaves very little lacing on the glass. T- I do not taste the the alcohol that I found in the smell. It has a nice sweet dark fruit. M- Light carbonation that coats the mouth nicely. O- A very tasty beer from a historic brewery. I have not had many barleywines but I’m beginning to love them more and more.
Wyra?ny s?odkawy smak, pi?kna barwa. To dopiero moje drugie Barley Wine i jeszcze niezbyt dobrze si? w nich orientuje, ale chyba b?dzie to jeden z nich ulubionych gatunków.

Pours a dark brown body with a thick beige head. Very nice aroma of burnt sugar. Well balanced malty taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle one month past its drink-by date. 
L: a murky dark amber with a tan head. 
S: an upfront whiff of booze gives way to the most delicious plum, cherry and dark fruits, I’m instantly taken back to my grandma’s dense fruitcake. Yum. 
T: plenty of alcohol coming through, but I’m getting strong malt and fruit too. 
F: full-bodied and warms the mouth and throat. It seems to fluctuate, some sips are malty, some boozy. 
O: I get this better now than when I first tried it a few years back. Would go lovely by a fire on a winter’s evening.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- Has a very nice fruit smell
Appearance- Pours a murky brown with a tan colored head 
Taste- Fruit is dominant, real good flavor
Palate- A heavy bodied beer with moderate carbonation, has a strong alcohol finish
Overall- A real good barleywine, I would drink this again
Deep ruby red, with a medium tan lacing head. Sweet malts, dried fruit, lively carbonation... thick and rich, with a warming boozy finish. Nice.

Warka 12/2016. Wygląda na to, że zbyt wiele oczekiwałem od tego piwa.
Już sam aromat nieco przystopował moje zapędy. Old Foghorn owszem pachnie ładnie jednak mało intensywnie.
W smaku przyjemne lecz nieco zbyt wytrawne.
Dobre lecz z nóg nie zwala (chyba, że mocą).

Bottle - fair size foamy head, murky dark brown color, complex dark fruity aroma and flavor, big malty backbone but well balanced overall, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cor cobre avermelhado, espuma bege abundante, de fácil formação, persistente, linda cerveja. Aroma adocicado, caramelo torrado, licor de passas, morango, malte de torrefação média, lúpulo discreto mas presente, aroma muito bem equilibrado. Paladar adocicado médio, trouxe notas claras de uvas passas, frutas vermelhas e um amargor mais forte que no aroma. Corpo oleoso, aveludado, carbonação leve, álcool perceptível mas bem inserido. Aftertaste médio/duradouro, puxando mais para o aroma de uvas vermelhas e passas, açúcar mascavo com um pouco de amargor, dulçor sempre presente e em dose certeira. Muito boa, mas estranhei o efeito do dry hopping.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Beautiful clear, deep brown, with a creamy tanned head. Sweet aromas, toffee, nuts, malt, pine. Fairly high carbonated, full body, thick, creamy mouthfeel. The taste is sweet and malty, caramel, bread, raisins, toffee, citrus peel, orange. Pleasant bitterness and some warming booze in the finish.
Miedziane z beżową pianą. Aromaty bananowe, nuty chmielowe, owocowe i słodowe. W smaku znów banany, słód, lekka czekolada. Niskie wysycenie, piwo treściwe z kwaskowym posmakiem, Przyjemne.

Bottle from SB 150613.
Pours a clear mahoganny with a lasting beige head. Very heavy aroma with banana, dried dark fruits, molasses and malt. Sweet taste with malt, prunes, treacle and candy/foam bananas. Not much hoppiness really but a nice bitter aftertaste. An excellent sippin' ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful warm red colour. Smells banana! Round sweet malty taste and ...banana, alocohol. Long sweet and hoppy finish, alcohol noteable in finish too. I love bananas, so i thoroughly enjoy this barley wine.

Ambar tirando a marrón. Escasa espuma. Aroma muy lupulado, a ciruelas maduras y uvas. Excelente textura, suave y cremosa. Sabor de malta como dominante, pero muy aderezada por otras muchas cosas, caramelo, chocolate y especialmente por los toques lupulados. Final seco y limpio. Muy disfrutable.

S:
-lemons,orange peel,caramel,raspberry,elderflower,apricot,pine
T:
-Follows the nose plus grapefruit
F:
-low carbonation
O:
-Great barley wine

Un barley wine, brassé depuis 1975, de 9,4 % abv, fait de first wort et en dry hop.
Couleur châtain moyen à roux ambré, à la clarté nette.
Bulles moyennes en colonnes droites, peu nombreuses et très calmes.
Mousse beige moyen bien crémeuse, stable à 6 mm.
Arômes de vin, bois, pointe de cannelle, cassonade, feuille de vigne, malt cara.
1ère bouche souple à veloutée, sur du vin capiteux, des épices et quelques herbes.
Arrière-bouche suave, longue.
2ème sur du bois de fût, des châtaignes.
Arrière-bouche vineuse, complexe, longue.
3ème sur du malt très doux, beaucoup de vin, du chai, des fruits mûrs.
Arrière-bouche forte, épicée, dense.
Longueur avec beaucoup de fruits, du bois, levure, malt, vraiment très vineuse.
Jambes souples, bien marquées.
Levure douce, mais avec du caractère.
Alcool très bien, progressif, action massive sur les saveurs.
Finale qui se savoure, au sens propre.
CONCLUSION : un très grand barley wine, qui donne de la matière pour la philosophie de la 
bière. Toutes nos félicitations à l’Ancre californienne ...

bottle bought at Dobre Pivo, Ljubljana. smell is very malty sweet, maltose, malt syrup, notes of dried fruits, plums, light liqueurish / alcoholic. full body, soft carbonation & light sticky mouthfeel. tastes alcoholic, malty sweet, molasses, light sticky, dried fruits, plums, syrup, some citric notes, oranges, syrupy sweet finish. good, was expecting a bit more though, a bit bitter-sweet.

Bottle 355ml. Hazy brown colour with an off white head that fades rather quickly. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and alcohol. Lovely. The taste is in line with the aroma: sweetness with a mix of chocolate, coffee and a bitter undertone. The warmness of alcohol lasts for a long time.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Big, bubbly, beige head. Dark copper colored body. Smells hoppy, some citrus and oak in it. The taste is very sweet, with barley, sugar, yeast and a bitter aftertaste. Great stuff.

Thats a beer... No it’s a barley wine. And a very good one to. Creamy stable head and an Explosion of very pleasent smells. Color is Red to Brown and a bit hazy. Nose is raisin chrismas fruits and hints of lime. Taste is a Hammer of yeast and chocolate and some taste like Port or Sherry with a slight alcoholic warmth. I damn like it much...

Piana drobna ale sycząca, przypomina tą z szampana, szybko znika niemal do zera. Barwa jasno miedziana tudzież ciemno bursztynowa, opalizująca. Aromat wprost powalający - cała feria suszonych słodkich owoców z gruszkami, figami i rodzynkami na czele, syrop klonowy, miód spadziowy gdzieś w tle chmiel i likier - rewelacja! W smaku lekko słodkie, sumarycznie czuć wszystko z aromatu, fajna rozgrzewająca likierowość i lekka goryczka chmielowa w afterteasie. W odczuciu dość treściwe, oleiste ale nie gęste, nie wyklejające, bardzo gładkie, rozpływające się od razu po języku i podniebieniu, nagazowanie wysokiego jak w belgijskich Ale, drobne. Alkohol mógłby być z deczko lepiej ukryty.
Bardzo smaczny BW. Lekko piecze w podniebienie, co lubię. Bardzo aromatyczny: leśne owoce, słody, trochę chmielu, drewno. W smaku podobnie. Ciało gęste. W tej kategorii cenowej rewelacja.

Pours mahogany colour with an apology for a head. I couldn’t find a trace of american hops in the aroma but what I got instead was even better. A mixture of dried fruits, raisins, a gentle alcohol note. The taste is pretty much the same, the beer is sweet but not cloggy, warms up a bit but is not alcoholic. In fact, it puts me in mind of some belgian strong ales or quadruppels, the only exception is the absence of phenols. Pour me an another bottle please!

BOTTLE 12 OZ from Bov. 9,4% ABV. It’s got some citrus hops over solid malts, loads of dried fruit with mildly oxidized notes (apricot?) and a touch of alcohol that spices the thing up. The taste is mighty sweet, yet not sugary but rather fruity. The big balancing bitterness feels somewhat harsh and phenolic, but after a while it either mellows down or the palate gets used to it, but everything comes together in a perfect harmony. Great brew.

Dark brown/purple hue and nearly opaque with a negligible head. Robust aroma consisting of red grapes, cherries, blackberries, alcohol, malt, caramel, and slight vanilla. Full bodied and quite rich. Smooth and sweet combination of grapes, cherries, blackberries, caramel, vanilla, and alcohol with a sweet and mildly hoppy finish. Very nice.
Copper color, toffee and caramel aroma, great body with some bitterness, flavor of pepper and caramel.
Shining brown, medium tan head, medium retention. Toffee aroma. Alcohol in the taste, medium sweet, bitter finish. Medium to full body. Oily texture, average carbonation.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 22C). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: slight floral and pine-like hop aroma, with a high malty presence with notes of caramelized malt, peppery alcohols and slight dried grapes. malt aroma more prominent than hops. APPEARANCE: reddish copper color with slight orange highlights and good clarity. medium ivory head with good retention. alcohol derived viscosity with lacing. TASTE: strong malty and sweet presence with notes of peppery alcohols, caramelized malt. low hop flavours with a floral character. medium-high bitterness with a semi-dry and bitter finish. PALATE: meidum-full body with a slight velvety texture and alcohol warmth. moderate carbonation. OVERALL: an american barleywine with less hop notes that advertised, maybe from long conditioning.

Colour is amber with greenish shades. Tan head.
Aroma is honey, orange, fried plantain, iron.
Taste is mildly sweet, full body, low CO2. Not very long finish.
wonderful sweet fruit flavour with a sharper finish. Only problem is why many Anchor beers are so sugary..

335 ml bottle

Dark amber to deep ruby red clear beer with blonde head. Aroma has dark fruits, toffee sweetness and ripe fruity marmalade.. Flavor has raisin and toffee with some pine. Palate is full and foamy. Finish has quite strong bitterness. Aftertaste has raisin and syrupy sweetness, light saltiness, light licorice, some spiciness. A bit of alcohol. Especially nice aroma. Good refreshing slow-sipper. Not so far from dark Belgian Strong Ales.
355ml bottle. White medium creamy head. Clear dark caramel color. Aroma is wood, oak, chocolate, alcohol, nettles, herbs, caramel, sugar. Very sweet taste with wood and sugar.

An old stalwart. More British inspired old barley wine.
Rich brown colour. no lasting head or beading.
Malty. Very malty. Rich treacle and molasses banana dried fruit and brown sugary end.Over time it displayed an aged sherry whisky element.
Quite unique really.

Tried on tap. Colour is slightly hazy brown/orange. Aroma is malts, caramel, dark fruits, almonds and slight fruit hops. Taste is also sweet malts, dark fruits, caramel. Mild bitter, slight smoke finish. Strong alcohol taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Pours a cloudy deep red liquid with a medium tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is sweet and malty with caramel, toffee, dried red fruits, honey, perfume. Big mouth feel with a smooth texture, medium carbonation. Flavors include caramel, toffee, pleasant bitter spices & herbs, syrup, dark fruits. Lasting bitterness. Nice balance, not more, not less, a very good barley wine.

Aroma: malty, dried fruits, caramel, toast, alcohol
Taste: heavy sweet, light bitter, malty, caramel, toast, alcohol, fruity

Flaska. Rödbrun vätska med ett snyggt smutsvitt skum. Dofter av karamell, frukt och brunt socker. Smakinslag av torkad frukt, läder, toffee och alkohol. Saknar tyngd och en större kropp för ett högre betyg. Nu är det en bra öl, men bara en okey Barley wine.

Bottle bought at Systembolaget Valbo. Even though I tried this one a few times it’s almost undrinkable. Very strong unpleasant taste of alcohol, hard carbonation and waaaay too bitter. Must be drunk to drink this kind of beers.

친애하는 샌프란시스코의 형님 브루어리. 실력파 올드스쿨. 따르자마자 엄청나게 가라앉는 침전물. 무슨 한약 내리는줄 앎. 코냑-레드와인 류의 시작, 입안에 온통 쌍화탕 냄새 ㅎㅎ Lexington,KY
https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot

Reddish brown colour with no head. Aroma of fruits, some herbs, oak and yeasts. Flavour is very malty, sweet with fruity notes and with little carbonation. Alcohol is very well hidden. A surprisedly very good beer.
Best in this beer is definitely aroma. Deep, thick, sweet malty aroma, with delicate alcoholic graze. Very good solid barley wine.
Barley Wine er ikke helt min favorittype. Rødbrun i fargen med bra luftig skum. Lukter noe fruktig og alkohol. Smaker litt besk og søtlig. Medium med kullsyre. Litt tørr bitter avslutning.

March 27, 2015 - bottle from Blue Max. Brownish orange pour with some head that faded somewhat quickly. Aroma was malty, caramel, dark fruit and light hops. Sweet malt and fruit dominate the flavors with a mild dry bitter finish.

Bottle BBE: 12.2013 (Aged). Lightly chilled. Pours a cloudy copper scarlet with a moderate, almost greenish yellow head. Medium intensity aromas of cheese & onion, cat litter, chestnuts, almonds, sweet cherry and cranberry. A subtle red fruit, Christmas Pudding sweetness, swiftly followed by a heavy, blunt bitterness and sourness. Very full body with a thick, chewy texture. Low to medium carbonation and a touch of liquorice in the finish. Overall a delightful, sipping barley wine. Aging doesn’t do much to take the edge off its alcohol punch though.

Pours a dark red with a low head. Pretty viscous beer with aromas of caramel, sweet malt, sweet dark fruits, nuts and some slight fruity hoppiness hiding behind the big, bold malt aroma. Flavor has huge caramel, sweet malt, freshly toasted bread, toffee, slight milk chocolate and nuts. The american hops are even more in the background of the flavor. Delicious beer that i will most definitely purchase in the future.

Aroma: sweet malt, prunes, caramel
Palate: sweet, well rounded, "fluffy" feel
Taste: dark fruits, caramel, malty, well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355ml, pours clear redish with white fast falling head. Aroma of candies, red fruits, flowers and honey with a hint of grapefruit and melon. The taste makes the first impression of being very sweet, but it’s underlined by some delicate bitterness and a refreshing sourness that remains long in the aftertaste. Alcohol is good hidden and it’a very good drinkable. Imo it could be a little less liqueury, but still it’s a very pleasant one.

Drink bottle version. Very nice dark red color. Nice 3/4 inch beige head. 
NIce aroma and superb malty flavor. Not to sweet. Superb beer

reddish brown color with minimal head. Nose is sweet malty with some perfumish tones. Taste is malty with some fruity tones kicking in especially at the end. Pretty complex finish. Tones of warming alcohol in the end.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours amber with a medium white and rich carbonation. Smell has some alcohol, malts, yeast and something that is reminding me of flowers or seeds. Taste is strong and full. Sweet malts, some caramel and syrup, though it could taste even more. Palate is oily and smooth. Overall a pretty nice beer, though it hasn’t anything over the ordinary to offer.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a thin white head, malty aroma with hints of fruit, taste is malty and fruity with a short sweet finish.

Clear amber pour, small quick head. Nose is honey, soft fruit, roasted malt, and a stray hop cone or two. More sweet than bitter. Middle is toffee, apricots, honeydew, and alcohol. Finish is bittersweet warming.

Bottle at Cherry Reds Cafe. Reddish copper, mostly clear. Carbonation dissipates a bit quickly. Massive alcohol in the aroma, along with cough drop, caramel, nuts, some vegetable. Weird sort of burnt plastic bag smell (ok not that bad) that seems present in a few US ales (Anchor IPA & Founders Centennial). Taste is strong alcohol; everything else comes second. It is sweet with a bitter/sour hoppy aftertaste, but mostly all you get 
is the booze. It’s only 10% but I feel like my ears are bleeding. Having said all this, it’s actually not a bad beer per se, just intensely unsubtle.
Drucken ur Pensmugg. Underbart rödfärgad men tyvärr med dålig skumbildning. Kittlar läckert på tungspetsen. Dominerande söt smak av framförallt karamell. God men något slät.

Barwa ciemno miedziana z czerwonymi odcieniami. Piana średnia, szybko zanikająca co nie jest dziwne na tak mocnym piwie. Za to pięknie oblepia szkło.
Piwo to prawdziwa bomba słodowa, niezwykle słodka, pełna i gęsta. Wydaje się, że ze zboża nic więcej nie da się już "wycisnąć". Smak to podobnie jak w aromacie słodkie rodzynki i suszone morele. Delikatnie wyczuwalne zioła pochodzące pewnie od chmielu. Goryczka jest na średnim/niskim poziomie, ale genialnie komponuje się z resztą. W tym wszystkim idealnie ukryty jest alkohol, którego właściwie nie czuć. Bardzo złożony, pełny smak.

On tap at Craft, Calgary. Pours slightly hazy red with a tan head. Aroma is sea salt, caramel, and vanilla. Caramel up front with notes of spice and roasted malts. Grapefruit on the finish. Excellent barleywine!

#2000 Rating of this beer, yay! 355 ml. bottle @ home. Procured from ABC Beers. BBF 05/2016. Deep dark hazy amber, small lightly off-white head with great lacing. Smell is thick cooked apples, caramel nose, maple, deep cooked fruits, malty, light port, thick cloves,… yummy. Taste is earthly hops, caramel, light leaves, cloves, cooked deep apples, first time hops make sense to me in a Barley wine, apple peel, caramel malts, smallest touch of warming work,… lightly warming. Body is substantial, malty & hoppy but not overtly thick or heavy. Earthly bitter hops. Wonderful earthly & autumn leave notes. Brekle’s Brown, Porter & Steam Beer were honestly let-downs for me but this was extremely impressive to spectacular.
Not my favorite. Well balanced. It has a red look and a nice finish. Fresh whole hops and the richest runnings of a thick all-malt mash. Has a nice warm finish.

A very good barleywine. Pours a beautiful bright red with a tan head. Smells of vanilla and salted caramel. Taste is malty, with vanilla, caramel and sea salt. Very refreshing and tasty. Had in the bottle.

Deep amber to ruby, off white head which is not very long lasting. Wonderful aroma of a fruit salad covered with candied sugar. Taste is sweet caramel and toffee, candy sugar, candied fruit, dark fruit allround, spices, light bitterness in the finish. Full bodied and sticky.

355ml brown bottle. Orange, clear, thin layer of beige head with minimal lacing. Nose has fruit, citrus, toffee and brown sugar. Taste has toffee malts, brown sugar, orange. Finishes bitter, bit of alcohol. Hops in the aftertaste with some rich malts. Very nice.

Opaque mahogany color with rich and creamy beige head. Very sweet aroma, toasted malts, brown sugar, caramel and floral hints. Taste is also very sweet, with sugary and caramely notes, toffee, toasted malts and some alcohol with a very light and pleasant hoppy bitterness. Really nice.

Pours a clear red brown ale with a bit beige fine stable head.
Smells hoppy and fruity, some caramel malts also. nose is perfect no off flavours in my opinion.
Tastes bitter.
Leaves a hoppy, bitter and fruity palate.
In the aftertaste you get more of the maltyness.
This is a full bodied beer with a clear alcoholic taste.
Really love this beer!

Bottles. Pours ruby-copper beautiful body with white thin foam. Impressive and fury aroma - some hops, a lot of subtle caramel malts, note of alcohol, some grass/woods. Bitter-sweet palate with some interesting fruity-bitterness on the edge of the tongue, rather thick. Finish is prolonged, well accented. Very nice!

Aged 2012 vintage.  Opened 2/17/2015. I bought this bottle in 2012 while living in Rockford, Illinois. Shortly after, I moved to Atlanta, and the bottle came with me. Shortly after that, I moved to Chicago, and the bottle came with me. There it sat for 2 years, until I moved to Christchurch, New Zealand, where the bottle came with me. And now, to celebrate the successful arrival of my cellar, I open one of my most well traveled beers. Pours a cloudy dark amber with little head. What’s there is tan and clings well to the glass. Certainly oxidized aroma. Caramels, toffee, and port wine. Flavor is of raisins, plums, and sour cherries all baked in a crumble with caramel drizzle. Bitterness balances the sweetness nicely. The chewy texture and lingering bitterness help slow you from drinking it too quickly. 
----------------------------------------
Aged 2012 vintage.  Opened 1/7/2016.  Aggressive pour produces nearly no head to the murky brown beer.  Flavours and aromas similar to 2015 tasting but heavier on the raisin component and I’m picking up less oxidation in this bottle.
----------------------------------------
Aged 2011 bottle.  Opened 4/2/2015.  Aromas of molasses, salted caramels, and alcohol.  No oxidation.  Flavour opens with deep caramel richness and moves to taffy apples and raisins.  Some light alcohol in the finish, but by no means strong.  Full bodied and a lingering raisin finish.  This one has held up significantly better than the 2012.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt dimmigt brun med lite beige skum. Doft av karamell och choklad. Liknande smaker men också inslag av kaffe och humle.

Bottle at the Norwich Tap House. Pours an amber/brown colour with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, raisins, hop and fruit. Sweet with a touch of bitterness, soft carbonation. Dry and lightly bitter finish.

Pours a nice mahogany-brown with a finger of light-khaki head. Very malty bouquet with a thick, grainy and sweetish aroma jumping out of the glass. Caramel, roasted almonds, porridge, semi-dark bread and syrup. The palate is full bodied and semi-sweet with nice roasted malt notes, an almost floral character midway and a medium length finish with low bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice thickness on the tongue. Nice head. Sweet and carmel with a light toffee burnt flavor. Head last and last. Thickness is what I would want. Overall a nice traditional barley wine. Like most anchor beers top notch.

A very solid brew. Creamy with a great balance between malty and hoppy. Strikes with easy to drink, creamy and light body. Oranges and toffee are the main aromas. Still more complex then that with candied fruits like anana, figs, mango and banana. Very enjoyable only think that might put off is the cough syrup aftertaste.

A great old school barley wine. Pours a ruby rouge with a burnished brown body with a thin, creamy off white head. A solid amount of carbonation in the body. The aroma is rich with tons of toffee and caramel malt notes as well as toasted bread and floral hop notes. A nice well balanced profile with lots of heavy malts and more reserved hop notes of light spice, citrus and perfume. A light hop bitterness with a moderate resinous finish. A moderate alcohol presence on the finish leaves a warmth that perfectly accommodates the thick, rich profile.

Bottle from Lisbeer, Portugal. Color is dark copper. Head is super persistent, white and thin to medium. Taste is medium sweet. Nicely balanced taste. Aroma is malty, hoppy, wood, chocolate. I’m usually not into barley wines, but this proves me I’m possibly wrong.
Amber with off white head - Good sweet malt aroma - Sweet malt body with dark fruits and some hints of fruity hops in the back with some hints of alcohol - Sweet malt finish - This was real good
Slightly too bitter for me in the taste, but a nice aroma and nice looks on this beer. Never thought too much of this brewery but they were one of the first craft breweries exported into Sweden.

ENG: 355ml bottle from Liquor Mart Winnipeg, poured into the tulip. Very dark amber color, very clear. Nice medium to high dark yellow head. Aromas of roasted malts, caramels and herbal, citrusy and pine hops with some bready / sourdough aromas. Taste is very heavy, smoky, roasted caramel, cloves, licorice, prunes, sweet grapes, soy sauce and hint of sweet bubblegum. At the finish theres some sour-bitter taste of cough drops. It’s really heavy beer, especially in taste, it’s creamy, oily and thick. There’s some medium carbonation and full body. It’s a very deep beer, but not necessarily hitting my tastes. For me too heavy, but for sure interesting! ////~~~///!!!///~~~//// ////~~~///!!!///~~~//// PL: Butelka 355ml kupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg, przelana do kieliszka. Ciemno bursztynowe, klarowne. Ładna średnio-duża ciemno-kremowa piana. Aromaty palonych słodów, karmeli oraz ziołowo-cytrusowo-żywiczne chmiele z dodatkiem zakwasu chlebowego. W smaku bardzo ciężkie, wędzonka, palone karmele, goździki, lukrecja, suszona śliwka, słodkie winogrona, sos sojowy i nieco słodkiej gumy do żucia. Pod koniec i w posmaku wyczuwalny kwaśno-gorzki syrop na kaszel. To naprawdę ciężkie, mocne piwo, szczególnie w smaku, kremowe, oleiste i gęste. Średnie nasycenie, pełne ciało. Bardzo ciekawe, głębokie piwo, nie koniecznie w moim guście - nieco zbyt ciężkie, jednak zdecydowanie interesujące!

Dark amber/red colour with a creamy head. Aroma of caramel, burnt sugar and fruity notes of apricot, orange, berries and alcohol. Taste of caramel and fruits. A smooth, round flavour with a good feel of alcohol. Fruity sweetness and a rich feel of burnt sugar and alcohol. More taste of apricot, orange, butterscotch and molasses.

0,3 l beczka. Bardzo ładna, bursztynowa, brunatna barwa. W smaku suszone owoce, słodkie winogrona, truskawki(?). Aromat owoców cytrusowch, słodu. Pierwsze wrażenie w smaku to przypieczony tost, który na długo pozostaje na podniebieniu. Po ogrzaniu pojawia się intensywny smak słodowy. Alkohol doskonale ukryty. Bardzo dobre piwo na długi wieczór. Z racji tego, że był to mój pierwszy BW biorę go jako wzór stylu.

Fruktigt och bärigt söt maltdoft med inslag av hallon och jordgubbe samt lite karamelliserat socker. 
Vackert tegelfärgad brygd och ett mycket bra skum med stadga och lång halveringstid.
Smaken är söt och med en påklistrad beska. Kolaaktig och med russintoner. Ointressant och obalanserad. Hade förväntat mig mer av denna barley wine från Anchor.
Fint avvägd kolsyra men lite platt i kroppen.
Eftersmaken är även den kantig och obalanserad.

Color ambar oscuro translúcido. Espuma beige no mu persistente. aroma fruta madura, cituela pasa,, malta, y un toque algo citrico de fondo y alcohólico. En boca se torna dulce, con sabores a malta, afritado, y algo lupulos aunque de foondo. la carbonatacion es media y la textura algo pegajosa. El final es muy mantido donde el amargor se hace mas presente, junto con el de frutas secas, ciruela Mi primer barley wine...y la verdad me ha gustado...lo recomiendo.
Flaska från SB. Gyllene brunröd färg med tjock smutsvitt skumkrona. Spritig doft av torkad frukt, portvin och smörkola. Spritig smak av russin, portvin och lakrits- fudge.

Pours hazy dark Amber with some cream head. Aroma of cane sugar and a bit of hop. Thick and sweet in the mouth with hints of bubble gum and some alcohol. Low bitter finish. Update: an awesome herb aroma when it’s warm.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark red, crystal-clear; creamy head. Aroma is malty and caramely with some evident notes of dark fruit. Taste wise one can feel the perfect combination of sweetness and hoppiness; it’s not an overy sweet, liquorish barleywine. Extremely drinkable

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown and red. With a offwhite head. Smells of sweet malt, dark fruit, raisins and soil. Moist soil. Taste is thick, bit sweet, low carbonation. Quite strong are, I like that.

This was poured into a chalice.
The appearance was a nice looking brown color with a slight transparency running about it. A slim half finger-ed white foamy head quickly dissipated. Light somewhat speckled lacing clings yet slides in a good quick thirty seconds.
The smell had a big sweet vanilla backed up by a big sweet caramel and light fruity (somewhat like plums).
The taste was mainly sweet through the vanilla and caramel. There was a slight tobacco aftertaste with a mildly dry finish.
On the palate, this sat about a medium on the body with a good sipping quality about it. A light tobacco-like quality combined with the vanilla to roll sweetly yet subtly over my tongue.
Overall, I’d say this was a pretty good English Barleywine.

Flaske 355ml fra Systembolaget, Kiruna. Drukket under nyttårsmiddag i Skibotn 31 Des 14. Mørk rødbrun. 0 skum. God plomme-/ferskenaroma. Smaken syrlige bær. Gjennomgående sherrypreg. Passet perfekt til multekrem!

Tap. Aroma: malty, slightly fruity, raisins. Deep amber/red/brown colour with small head. Full, porter-ish taste which is a bit fruity, a bit spicy, with medium bitterness and warming finish. Interesting barley wine.
Brownish red color. Off white head. Aroma of caramel. Dried fruit. Smooth full body. Sweet, fruity taste.

355ml bottle. Copper body with a medium white head. Caramel, figs, dried fruit. Well made.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Pours brown with a small light brown head. Smells nutty hoppy, citrus and some parfume. Tastes nutty, s bit sweet, hoppy with a thick bitter sweet finish.
Väldigt tilltalande färg och skum. Djup arom och smaken väldigt fin. Lite spritig avslutning

Somewhere between hazy and cloudy mahogany color, small off-white head. Aroma is bubblegum, yeast, sugar, some dark fruits, caramel and malt. Fruity kick in my face, also some bubblegum in taste, some caramel and a bit of alcohol. Full body, flat carbonation. Sweet finish. Foghorn, you are great! 
(0,33l bottle)
Mørk brunorange med høyt beige skum som legger seg fort. Mørke frukter og bær, svisker og alkohollukt. Karamell, frukt og alkoholsøt. Fyldig. Kjenner alkoholen og gjærsmaken. Litt oljete. Koseøl...

Aroma here is classic toffee, berries, rich malts and a small hint of hops. The taste is truly great, maybe not the best in the world, but up there in the top layers. Rich and full malts, sweetness from ripe oranges and some spices. It’s almost a little too sweet, but the warming sensation that sets in after a while makes this a winner.
Thick head. Nice lace. Cloudy dark brown. Strong hop aroma. Cinnamon and nutmeg complex flavor.

Aroma of fig, plum, pumpkin pie spice, wheat bread and molasses. Slightly boozy. Reddish amber color with off white foam. Tastes like everything in the aroma except without the spice and a little more booze. Strong dark fruit flavor. Barleywines should be a little hot and slightly bitter; this one delivers just enough of these qualities. The palate is the only substandard aspect of this beer; I was expecting something more substantial. I'm glad I did not age this one - it's great fresh.

2 vintages, 2010 & 2014, very very different!



2010:



A – Very see through, extremely glowingly strong red colour, very faint disappearing head.



S – Caramel, nutty, browned butter, figs, apricot, huge aroma, kind of reminder to Tom Hardy’s.



T – Loads of caramel, with nutty burned noisette feel, very balanced, and not that sweet, lots of lighter fruits like dried apricot, peach and some fig.



M – Perfectly carbonated, and a bit more full than fresh.



O – 9/5/9/5/12 Total 4.3



2014:



A – Orange copper with a solid head.



S – A bit grapefruit, a bit caramel malt, bready, and quite nutty, loads of pale malt and light caramel.



T – Very easy going, nice malt backbone with some lighter caramel, hops are really quite present, floral grapefruit with some grassy bitterness.



M – A bit too carbonated and quite thin.



O – 7/4/7/3/11 Total 3.4

Aw yeah. I’ve been wanting to try Old Foghorn since I saw Anchor’s cellar and heard our tour guide talk about the months required for this Barley Wine to mature into the rich malt bomb that it is. It did not disappoint. The reddish-brown color and frothy head made it easy on the eyes, and the flavors were equally approachable. Barley Wines can have robust personalities, but this one wasn’t overbearing at all. Caramel, brown sugar, hints of chocolate, booze, and candied dark fruits. The hops help to keep the flavors from becoming too heavy or cloying, but impart little bitterness. This is a full-bodied brew that would be right at home with a rich dessert or - better yet - a good cigar.

Zapach z butelki: Intensywny, żywiczno-ananasowy.

Piana: Dość skąpa, jasnobrązowa, drobno- i średniopęcherzykowa. Redukuje się do obręczy.

Kolor: Ciemnobursztynowe, klarowne z zawieszonymi drobinkami.

Zapach: Bardzo intensywny. Na pierwszym planie nuta cytrusowo-brzoskwiniowa, nuty żywiczne, zaraz potem biszkopt i toffi. Bardzo bogata gra aromatów, przeplatanie się. Słodowość, za chwilę chmiel, potem łagodne owocowe estry. Ciemniejsze słodowe nuty - rodzynki, delikatna nuta mlecznej czekolady. W miarę ogrzewania duża żywiczność, nuty tropikalne. Pojawiają się możliwe do wyróżnienia aromaty sosny, ananasa, lukrecji.
Smak: Głęboki i złożony. Obfita podbudowa herbatnikowo-chlebowa z nutą suszonej śliwki. Owocowość świeżych śliwek i wiśni. Intensywna, korzenna słodycz w typie lukrecji. Spora ziołowość. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Słodycz dominuje, choć odczuwalna jest delikatna kwaskowość jak w wiśniach wyjętych z nalewki.

Tekstura: Ciało pełne, piwo dość ciężkie, nieco lepkie. Masywne i nieco oleiste, wykleja policzki i podniebienie.

Nasycenie: Średnie.

Goryczka: Wysoka, ziołowa.

Pijalność: Średnia.

Coś wspaniałego. Złożoność smaku i aromatu tego piwa sprawiła, że musiałem usiąść i zamilknąć na kilka minut. Dzieje się mnóstwo rzeczy, obcowanie z tym piwem stanowi swoisty wstrząs, wstrząs ekstatyczny. Z jednej strony potężna słodowość z bukietem zacnych cech - z drugiej czuć, że nie żałowano chmielu. Jest tutaj fantastyczna równowaga smaków, wszystkiego jest w sam raz, przy czym wszystkiego jest po prostu dużo. Do tego niewiarygodnie zamaskowany alkohol. Polecam bardzo gorąco.
